National Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.

This Part is concerned with the transfer of heat and air through building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope, and interfaces between building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope.

National Article Title: 3.1.1.6. Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas 1) Fenestration and door areas shall be calculated to
National Sentence Text: Fenestration and door areas shall be calculated to the rough opening in the wall and shall include all related frame and sash members. (See Note A-3.1.1.6.(1).)

National Article Title: 3.1.1.6. Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas 1) Fenestration and door areas shall be calculated to
National Sentence Text: The calculation of allowable fenestration and door area in additions shall be based upon the addition being considered by itself, or the addition being considered together with the existing building, provided that the combined overall thermal transmittance of the addition and existing building meets the prescriptive or trade-off requirements.

Where a component of the building envelope is protected by an enclosed unconditioned space, such as a sun porch, enclosed veranda or vestibule, the unconditioned enclosure may be considered to have an overall thermal transmittance of 6.25 W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.1.1.7.(5).)
For the purposes of this Article, roof assemblies shall be considered to include all related structural framing.

Where mechanical ducts and chases or electrical system components, such as pipes, ducts, conduits, cabinets, panels, or recessed heaters, are placed within and parallel to the building envelope, the overall thermal transmittance of the building envelope at the projected area of the mechanical or electrical system components shall not be increased.

National Article Title: 3.2.2.4. Thermal Characteristics of Doors and Access Hatches
National Sentence Text: Access hatches that are part of a building envelope shall be insulated to a nominal thermal transmittance of not more than 1.3 W/(m2·K), exclusive of stiffeners or edge construction.
Variation Label: Above-ground Components of the Building Envelope

National Article Title: 3.2.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Floors in Contact with the Ground
National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground with no embedded heating ducts, cables or heating or cooling pipes that are required to be insulated shall have insulation placed on their top or bottom surface for a distance of not less than 1.2 m from their perimeter or over their full area as shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category.

Where the building envelope components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed in Section 3.2., the trade-off calculation is permitted to take this increased performance level into account, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant interaction.
Variation Label: Above-ground Components of the Building Envelope

National Article Title: 4.2.1.3. Limits to Installed Interior Lighting Power
National Sentence Text: The individual power allowances in each space of the building do not have to be met, provided the total installed interior lighting power is not exceeded.

National Article Title: 4.2.1.5. Calculation of Interior Lighting Power Allowance Using the Building Area Method
National Sentence Text: Where 10% or more of the gross lighted area of the building can be classified as being of a building type other than the principal type for the building, the interior lighting power allowance shall be calculated using the space-by-space method described in Article 4.2.1.6.

Lighting for covered vehicle entrances and exits from storage garages shall be separately controlled by a device that automatically reduces the lighting by at least 50% from sunset to sunrise. (See Note A-4.2.2.2.(3).)

National Article Title: 4.2.2.5. Determination of Daylighted Area Under Skylights
National Sentence Text: The daylighted area under skylights shall refer to the combined daylighted area under each skylight without double-counting overlapping areas. (See Note A-4.2.2.4. and 4.2.2.5.(1).)

National Article Title: 4.3.2.7. Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
National Sentence Text: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.9.

National Article Title: 4.3.2.7. Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
National Sentence Text: The daylight-dependent control factor for electric lighting, CEL,ctrl,i, shall be selected from Table 4.3.2.7.-B.

National Article Title: 4.3.2.9. Determination of the Daylight Supply Factor for Toplighting
National Sentence Text: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined using Table 4.3.2.9.-A.

National Article Title: 4.3.3.7. Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
National Sentence Text: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.9.

National Article Title: 4.3.3.7. Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
National Sentence Text: The daylight-dependent control factor for electric lighting, CEL,ctrl,i, shall be determined using Table 4.3.2.7.-B based on the minimum requirement for the applicable space according to the prescriptive path.
Manufactured insulation thicknesses shall not be altered.

National Article Title: 5.2.2.8. Cooling by Direct Use of Outdoor Air (Air Economizer System)
National Sentence Text: HVAC systems that use less mechanical cooling energy by direct use of outdoor air shall be capable of mixing return air with up to 100% outdoor air to produce the temperature required to condition the space.

For the purposes of this Subsection, the power demand of a fan system shall be the sum of the demand of all fans required to operate at design conditions to supply air to the conditioned space. (See Note A-5.2.3.1.(2).)
Dampers in air intakes and outlets serving air-heating or -cooling equipment located outside of the building envelope are permitted to be located within the equipment.
HVAC piping shall be designed and installed in accordance with the NBC.
Insulation on piping conveying chilled fluid shall be provided with vapour barrier protection to prevent condensation, where the surface temperature of the pipe is below the dew point of the air.
Each dwelling unit shall be controlled by at least one thermostatic control device.

An independent perimeter heating and cooling system designed to offset only building envelope heat losses or gains, or both, is permitted to be used, provided it includes at least one thermostatic control for each building exposure having exterior walls facing only one orientation for an uninterrupted distance of 15 m or more (see Note A-5.2.8.5.(2)(a)), and its heating and cooling energy supply is controlled by thermostat located within the zone it serves.
If an HVAC system is equipped with a means for adding or removing moisture to maintain specific humidity levels in a space, an automatic humidity control device shall be provided.
Zones with a total heating or cooling capacity requirement of less than 5 kW may be controlled by readily accessible manual controls.

HVAC pumping systems that are used on a seasonal basis shall be equipped with automatic controls, or readily accessible and clearly labeled manual controls that allow them to be shut down when not required.

HVAC systems with multiple boilers shall incorporate a means for preventing heat loss through the boilers when they are not operating, such as a device that prevents the flow of heat-carrying fluid through the boilers or dampers installed in the flues.
Except for equipment covered by Article 5.2.12.1. whose performance includes heat rejection energy, this Article applies to standalone heat rejection equipment. (See Note A-5.2.12.2.(1).)
This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).

National Article Title: 5.3.2.3. Determination of Trade-off Value of Components, ToVi
National Sentence Text: The trade-off value of component i, ToVi, to be used in the equation in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1), shall be determined in accordance with Table 5.3.2.3.
This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).

Service water systems shall be designed in accordance with the relevant provincial, territorial or municipal building regulations or, in the absence of such regulations, or where service water systems are not covered by such regulations, with the NPC.

Except for systems whose storage capacity is less than 100 L, each service water heating system shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled shut-off device that allows the system, including any heating elements installed along the pipes to maintain temperature, to be shut-off. (See Note A-6.2.4.2.(1).)

National Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Maintaining Temperature of Hot Service Water
National Sentence Text: Heating elements installed along service water heating system pipes to maintain the water temperature shall incorporate automatic controls that maintain the temperature of the hot water within the range required for the intended use.

Pool heaters shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled device that allows the heater to be shut off without adjusting the thermostat setting, and where applicable, the heater to be restarted without manually relighting the pilot light.

Pressure booster systems shall be provided with at least one pressure sensor that starts and stops the system or varies the pump speed so that the pressure required for operation of the service water system is maintained. (See Note A-6.2.8.2.(1).)
A SWH system shall be deemed to comply with Section 6.3. if its SWH trade-off index, SWH-TOI, as calculated in accordance with Subsection 6.3.2., is greater than or equal to 0.
Feeder conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 2% at design load.
Branch circuit conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 3% at design load.
If, during construction, the design is found to be altered from the one used in the original performance assessment, the building shall be reassessed for compliance with this Part.

Where the construction techniques or building components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed by the prescriptive requirements, the performance compliance calculations are permitted to take this increased performance level into account in the determination of the annual energy consumption, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant behaviour.

For urban regions with several climatic data sets and for locations where weather data are not available, the energy model calculations shall be performed using available weather data that best represents the climate at the building site.
The energy model calculations shall include a dynamic calculation of space temperatures.

National Article Title: 8.4.2.7. Internal and Service Water Heating Loads
National Sentence Text: Miscellaneous equipment located within a conditioned space that affects the energy consumption of one or more of the building systems described in Sentence 8.4.2.2. shall be included in the energy model and its energy consumption shall be calculated.

The insulated surface areas of roof assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated along the plane of the insulation using dimensions measured to the exterior surfaces of intersecting exterior walls.

The insulated surface areas of wall assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated using dimensions measured horizontally to the exterior surfaces of perimeter wall assemblies in contact with the ground, and vertically from the exterior ground level to the underside of intersecting floors in contact with the ground.
The energy model calculations shall determine how many hours the primary system, secondary system and terminal device loads are not met.

National Article Title: 8.4.3.2. Operating Schedules, Internal Loads, Service Water Heating Loads and Set-point Temperature
National Sentence Text: For semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), the set-point temperature of the proposed building shall be that shown in the specifications.

Where purchased energy is used for cooling, the equipment used to provide this energy shall be modeled as an electric air-cooled chiller that is sized for the peak cooling load provided by the purchased energy system, and complies with Table 8.4.3.5.
The operating schedule, priority of use and other operational characteristics of the purchased energy shall be included in the energy model.
Except for overall thermal transmittance, fenestration shall be modeled with thermal and optical properties that are identical to those used for the proposed building. (See Note A-8.4.4.3.(8).)

For the purpose of determining the daylighted area under skylights, the calculations shall be performed assuming a single square skylight positioned at the centre of each thermal block that is sized to meet the maximum skylight-to-roof ratio permitted by Article 3.2.1.4., and whose projection onto the floor extends horizontally in all directions for a distance equal to 0.5 times the ceiling height. (See Note A-8.4.4.5.(7).)
Heating equipment performance characteristics as a function of part-load shall be modeled in accordance with the part-load performance curves found in Table 8.4.4.21.-A.
Where variable-air-volume fans are used, individual fans having a fan power greater than or equal to 25 kW shall be modeled as forward curved with inlet vanes.

Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
P/T Sentence Text: 1.4.1.1.  Definitions of words and phrases used in this Code that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms with the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.  Despite Sentence , words and phrases may be assigned other meanings where specifically noted in another provision of this Code.

National Sentence Text: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
P/T Sentence Text: 1.4.1.1.  Definitions of words and phrases used in this Code that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms with the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.  Despite Sentence , words and phrases may be assigned other meanings where specifically noted in another provision of this Code.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of applying this Code, every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: Classification of buildings or parts thereof
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of applying this Code, a building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy by the Chief Fire Official in conformance with the Building Code.

National Sentence Text: Where a sign, notice, placard or information is required to be posted, it shall be clearly legible, and except as provided in Sentence 2.1.4.1.(2), permanently mounted in a conspicuous or prominent location in proximity to the situation to which it refers.
Except as otherwise required by this Code, portable extinguishers shall be selected and installed in accordance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire Extinguishers

Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 2.1.5.1.(2), portable extinguishers used to comply with this Code shall conform to the following performance standards as applicable: ULC CAN/ULC-S503-05 Carbon-Dioxide Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S504-12 Dry Chemical Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S507-05 Water Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S512-M87 Halogenated Agent Hand and Wheeled Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S554-16 Water Based Agent Fire Extinguishers and ULC CAN/ULC-S566-17 Halocarbon Clean Agent Fire Extinguishers

Where rooms or spaces within a building contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, such occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations in conformance with this Code and the NBC.

Protective guarding devices shall be provided where necessary to prevent damage to the mechanical components of doors in fire separations, and installed so as not to interfere with the proper operation of the doors.

Defects that interfere with the operation of closures in fire separations shall be corrected, and such closures shall be maintained to ensure that they are operable at all times by keeping fusible links and other heat-actuated devices undamaged and free of paint and dirt, keeping guides, bearings and stay rolls clean and lubricated, making necessary adjustments and repairs to door hardware and accessories to ensure proper closing and latching, and repairing or replacing inoperative parts of hold-open devices and automatic releasing devices.
P/T Sentence Text: Closures in fire separations shall be maintained to ensure that they are operable at all times by  keeping fusible links and heat or smoke-actuated devices undamaged and free of paint and dirt,  keeping guides, bearings and stay rolls clean and lubricated,  making necessary adjustments and repairs to door hardware and accessories to ensure proper closing and latching, and  repairing or replacing inoperative parts of hold-open devices and automatic releasing devices.

National Sentence Text: Combustible contents in interconnected floor spaces in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, shall not exceed the limit specified in Subsection 3.2.8. of Division B of the NBC.

Flame-retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2013 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flame retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705, "Recommended Practice for a Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films".

National Sentence Text: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. or be removed from the premises. (See Note A-2.4.1.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as greasy or oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence  or be removed from the premises.

National Sentence Text: All ashes shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same container.
P/T Sentence Text: Ashes shall be stored in receptacles that conform to Sentence  and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same receptacle.

National Sentence Text: Except for fires used for cooking in fireplaces, grills or barbecues, open air fires shall not be set unless appropriate measures are taken to limit their spread. (See Note A-2.4.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Open-air burning shall not take place unless  it has been approved, or  the open-air burning consists of a small, confined fire that is  used to cook food on a grill, barbecue or spit,  commensurate with the type and quantity of food being cooked, and  supervised at all times.

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.

National Sentence Text: Access to fire department connections for sprinkler or standpipe systems by firefighters and their equipment shall be maintained free of obstructions at all times.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire department sprinkler and standpipe connections shall be clearly identified and maintained free of obstructions for use at all times.

National Sentence Text: Streets, yards and roadways provided for fire department access shall be maintained so as to be ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire access routes shall be maintained so as to be immediately ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.

National Sentence Text: Coal and wood bins shall be located not less than 1.2 m from the appliance served.
P/T Sentence Text: Bins containing solid fuel shall be located at least 1.2 m from any appliance.

National Sentence Text: Hoods, ducts and filters subject to accumulations of combustible deposits shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 7 days, and shall be cleaned if the accumulation of such deposits creates a fire hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: Hoods, ducts and filters subject to accumulations of combustible deposits shall be checked at intervals not greater than seven days, and shall be cleaned if the accumulation of combustible deposits creates a fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Work on ducts involving the use of heat-producing devices for cutting, welding or soldering shall not be undertaken before the system has been shut down, the duct has been cleaned of any accumulations of combustible deposits, and any combustible lining and covering material that could be ignited by such work has been removed.
P/T Sentence Text: No work on ducts involving the use of hot work equipment shall be performed unless  the system has been shut down,  the duct has been cleaned of any accumulations of combustible deposits, and  any combustible lining and covering material that could be ignited by the work has been removed.

National Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC.
The number of occupants permitted to enter a room shall not exceed the maximum occupant load calculated in conformance with Sentence 2.7.1.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The number of persons occupying a room or floor space in an assembly occupancy shall not exceed the occupant load for the intended use as determined in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
P/T Sentence Text: Nonfixed row seating in an assembly occupancy shall be arranged as described in Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles leading to exits shall be provided so that there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle.

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of aisles shall be at least 1100 mm, except as permitted by Sentence .

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles required in Sentence  may be reduced in width to 750 mm when serving 60 seats or less, or 900 mm when serving seats on one side only.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting and exit signs shall be maintained in operating condition, in conformance with Section 6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting provided for illumination in exits and access to exits, including corridors used by the public, shall be maintained.

National Sentence Text: Where equipment is provided to melt snow or ice on exterior passageways and exterior exit stairs serving an occupied building, such equipment shall be maintained in working order or alternative measures shall be taken to comply with Sentence 2.7.1.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where equipment is provided to melt snow or ice on exterior passageways, exterior stairways and fire escapes in an occupied building, the equipment shall be maintained in working order or alternative measures shall be taken as specified in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Self-contained emergency lighting unit equipment shall be tested at intervals not greater than one month to ensure that the emergency lights will function upon failure of the primary power supply, and at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that the unit will provide emergency lighting for a duration equal to the design criterion under simulated power failure conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting unit equipment shall be tested  monthly to ensure that the emergency lights will function upon failure of the primary power supply, and  annually to ensure that the unit will provide emergency lighting for a duration equal to the design criteria under simulated power failure conditions.

National Article Title: Measures in a Fire Safety Plan
National Sentence Text: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared in cooperation with the fire department and other applicable regulatory authorities and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.
P/T Article Title: Measures in a fire safety plan
P/T Sentence Text: A fire safety plan shall be prepared, approved and implemented in buildings and premises to which this Section applies.

National Article Title: Measures in a Fire Safety Plan
National Sentence Text: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared in cooperation with the fire department and other applicable regulatory authorities and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.
P/T Article Title: Measures in a fire safety plan
P/T Sentence Text: A fire safety plan shall  provide for the emergency procedures to be followed in case of fire, including  sounding the fire alarm,  notifying the fire department,  instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds,  evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance,  procedures for use of elevators, and  confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire,  provide for the appointment and organization of supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties,  provide for the training of supervisory staff and the instruction of other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety,  include documents and diagrams showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems,  provide for the holding of fire drills and set out fire drill procedures,  provide for the control of fire hazards in the building,  provide for the maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants, and  provide for alternative measures to be provided for the safety of occupants during a shutdown of any or all fire protection equipment or systems.

National Sentence Text: In every hotel and motel bedroom, the fire safety rules for occupants shall be posted showing the locations of exits and the paths of travel to exits.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to Sentence , in a hotel establishment  one copy of the approved fire safety plan shall be posted in the main reception area, and  a copy of the emergency procedures, location of exits and the fire safety rules shall be posted on the inside of the egress doors of each guest suite.

National Sentence Text: Flame-retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2013 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flameproofing treatments shall be renewed as often as necessary to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705, "Recommended Practice for a Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films".

National Sentence Text: The electrical system and equipment in a tent or air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.

Staff members of daycare centres in which more than 10 children are cared for shall conduct fire prevention inspections in conformance with the fire safety plan at intervals not greater than one month.

When a covered mall having a width of not less than 9 m has been provided for the purpose of considering each portion of the building separated by the mall as a separate building, merchandising or public activities are permitted within the required 9 m width provided alternative protection is installed in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1..
P/T Sentence Text: When a covered mall having a width of 9 m or more has been provided for the purpose of considering each portion of the building separated by the mall as a separate building, no merchandising or public activities shall be carried on within the 9 m width.

National Sentence Text: When a covered mall having a width of not less than 9 m has been provided for the purpose of considering each portion of the building separated by the mall as a separate building, merchandising or public activities are permitted within the required 9 m width provided alternative protection is installed in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1..
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , merchandising or public activities or both may be carried on within the 9 m width where they are approved and they do not endanger life safety or alternative measures are taken to provide life safety.

National Sentence Text: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fuelled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fueled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
Reactive materials shall be stored based on their properties when classified as dangerous goods.
Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C558-14 Guide for the Investigation of Internal Combustion Engine-Powered Industrial Trucks
Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in storage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in storage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Any building located in an outdoor storage area shall be provided with portable extinguishers.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2 in each building located in a storage yard.

National Sentence Text: The storage site shall be level, and solid ground or paved with asphalt, concrete or other hard surface material.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage site shall be well drained and be level, solid ground or paved with asphalt, concrete or other hard surface material.

National Sentence Text: For closed containers of distilled beverage alcohol, the sprinkler system referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.3. shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-3.2.3.3.(2).)
Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in storage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Subsection, aerosol products shall be classified as Level 1, 2 or 3 in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (See Note A-3.2.5.2.(1).)
Chain link fencing referred to in Sentence 3.2.5.6. shall be not lighter than 2.9 mm steel wire woven into a 50 mm diamond mesh.
Except where the width of storage of dangerous goods is not more than 1.5 m, measured out from the wall, wall clearances of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained.

In addition to the separation requirements in Sentence 3.2.7.6.(1), dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with the information provided in the Safety Data Sheet for the specific dangerous good. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(3).)
In buildings regulated by Sentence 3.2.7.12.(1), access openings to each storey provided in conformance with the NBC shall be not less than 750 mm wide by 1 100 mm high. (See Note A-3.2.7.12.(3).)

Products classified as dangerous goods shall display appropriate identifying labels from the time they enter a facility until they are issued as finished products or waste material. (See Note A-3.2.7.13.(1).)
Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14. consist of multiple products within the same class, the individual class and division placard shall be posted.
Except for Class I commodities, dangerous goods shall not be stored in the same individual storage area with other products listed in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(1).

National Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
National Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 2.4 m shall be maintained between the oxidizing substances identified in Sentence 3.2.7.18. and any other dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.1.2.6.)

Main access aisles shall extend the length of the storage area where only one main access aisle is provided, or the length or width of the storage area where 2 or more main access aisles are provided.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one main aisle having a width equal to at least half the height of the highest adjacent pile and extending the length of the structure shall be provided but in no case shall the width of the aisle be less than 2.4 m.

National Sentence Text: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to exits, to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.

National Sentence Text: Main access aisles shall be accessible from at least 2 fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.
P/T Sentence Text: In storage areas that exceed 200 m2, main access aisles referred to in Sentence  shall be accessible from at least two fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.

National Sentence Text: Wall clearances of not less than 600 mm shall be maintained where stored products may swell or expand with the absorption of water.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall clearances of at least 600 mm shall be maintained where stored commodities may swell or expand with the absorption of water.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan required in Sentence 3.3.2.9. shall identify the location and classification of the products currently stored, as described in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1), the method of storage, including the clear spaces required and the maximum permitted size of individual storage areas, the location of fire alarm systems and firefighting equipment, and the control of fire hazards in and around the outdoor storage area.

Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: A building used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not  have basements or crawl spaces, or  contain open floor drains, tunnels, elevator pits or other pockets which might trap molten ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: It is permitted to waive the clearance required in Sentence 3.3.3.2. if the stored products do not consist of wood chips, hogged material, rubber tires or combustible pallets, the exposed wall of the building has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, and the stored products are separated from any unprotected wall opening by a horizontal distance of not less than 3 m on either side of the opening, and 6 m perpendicularly in front of the opening.

Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: A building used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall have not less than 70 cm2 in vent area for each square metre of storage area unless mechanical ventilation is provided.

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: A building used for the bulk storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed to prevent contact with building material that  will cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable,  may corrode or deteriorate by reason of contact with the ammonium nitrate, or  will become impregnated by ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: Any access route required in Article 3.3.2.5. shall be located so that a clear space of not less than 6 m is provided between stored rubber tires and the nearest side of the access route.
This Subsection shall apply to the storage of combustible fibres inside buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the indoor storage of combustible fibres.

National Sentence Text: The storage of dangerous goods in quantities exceeding the maximum exempted amounts stated in Table 3.2.7.1., in a single individual storage area, shall conform to this Subsection.

Unless the use of fuel-fired appliances and electrical heating elements is controlled in a manner such that they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, they shall not be permitted in a storage area for combustible fibres.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, fuel-fired appliances and electrical heating elements shall not be used in a storage area for combustible fibres.

National Sentence Text: Damaged or leaking packages or containers of dangerous goods shall be moved to a safe location and the product repackaged and labelled as soon as possible.

Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall be stored in detached buildings, in areas separated from the remainder of the storage area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less that 1 h, or in areas where the vehicles will not create a fire hazard to the storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall be stored in  detached buildings,  areas separated from the remainder of the storage area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, or  areas where the vehicles do not create a fire hazard to the storage area.

National Sentence Text: Battery-charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be located at least 1.5 m from combustible materials, when serving more than 2 trucks, in well ventilated areas, in areas where flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are not present in hazardous quantities, and in areas where precautions are taken to prevent ignition sources, such as open flames, sparks or electric arcs.
P/T Sentence Text: Battery charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be located  at least 1.5 m from combustible materials,  when serving more than two trucks, in well ventilated areas,  in areas where flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are not present in hazardous quantities, and  in areas where precautions are taken to prevent ignition sources, such as open flames, sparks or electric arcs.

National Sentence Text: Only trained and authorized personnel shall be permitted to operate industrial trucks, replace or refuel propane cylinders for fuel-fired industrial trucks, refuel fuel-fired industrial trucks, or charge batteries for battery-powered industrial trucks.
P/T Sentence Text: Only trained and authorized personnel shall  operate industrial trucks,  replace or refuel propane cylinders for fuel-fired industrial trucks,  refuel fuel-fired industrial trucks, or  change or charge batteries for battery-powered industrial trucks.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoking shall not take place in salvage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

National Sentence Text: ASTM D 3828-16a Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester is permitted to be used for testing aviation turbine fuels within the scope of this procedure.
P/T Sentence Text: The flash point of aviation turbine fuels may be determined in conformance with ASTM D3828, "Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester"

National Sentence Text: Used rags and similar materials contaminated with flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Article 2.4.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Cleaning rags shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3).

National Sentence Text: Spilled or leaked flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be flushed to a location where they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, or any risk to public health or safety, or neutralized or absorbed and cleaned up with the aid of a product that is compatible and non-reactive with the liquid being cleaned up (see Note A-4.1.6.3.(3)(b)), and deposited in a receptacle conforming to Article 2.4.1.3., or disposed of in a manner that does not create a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: Spilled or leaked flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be  flushed to a location where they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, or any risk to public health or safety, or  neutralized or absorbed and cleaned up with the aid of a product that conforms to ULC/ORD-C410A, Absorbents for Flammable and Combustible Liquids , or is compatible and non-reactive with the liquid being cleaned up, and  deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3), or  disposed of in a manner that does not create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: Where continuous mechanical ventilation is installed in order to meet the conditions of Sentence 4.1.7.2.(1), it shall be provided with automatic interlocks so that the activity generating flammable vapours cannot be performed when the ventilation system is not in operation, sound an audible alarm in an attended area upon shut-down of the ventilation system, and conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids
P/T Sentence Text: Where continuous mechanical ventilation is installed in order to meet the conditions of Sentence , it shall  be provided with automatic interlocks so that the activity generating flammable vapours cannot be performed when the ventilation system is not in operation,  sound an audible alarm in an attended area upon shutdown of the ventilation system, and  conform to NFPA 91, "Standard for Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids".

National Article Title: Location of Air Inlets and Outlets
National Sentence Text: Where the flammable vapour being removed is lighter than air, at least one air inlet shall be located at a point near a wall, and no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling, and at least one air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling.
P/T Article Title: Location of air inlets and outlets
P/T Sentence Text: If the flammable vapour being removed is lighter than air  at least one ventilation air inlet shall be located near a wall, no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling, and  at least one ventilation air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence 4.2.1.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.3.2. and Article 4.2.3.1., containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be distinctly marked or labelled in easily legible type that is in contrast to any other printed matter on the label with a warning to indicate that the material in the container is flammable, it should be kept away from heat, sparks and open flames, and it should be kept closed when not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 4.2.3.1., containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be distinctly marked or labelled in easily legible type which is in contrast to any other printed matter on the label with a warning to indicate that  the material in the container is flammable,  it should be kept away from heat, sparks and open flames, and  it should be kept closed when not in use.

National Sentence Text: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a container other than one of those listed in Article 4.2.3.1. shall be permitted only if the required purity of the liquid would be affected by containers of the types listed in Article 4.2.3.1. or if the liquid would cause the excessive corrosion of those types of containers, the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. has a capacity of not more than 1 L if used for Class I liquids and not more than 5 L if used for Class II or IIIA liquids, or the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. is a sample container used for quality control purposes or for testing by regulatory officials.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a container other than one of those set out in Article 4.2.3.1. may be used only if  the required purity of the liquid would be affected by containers of the types set out in Article 4.2.3.1. or if the liquid would cause the excessive corrosion of those types of containers,  the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. has a capacity of not more than 1 L if used for Class I liquids and not more than 5 L if used for Class II or IIIA liquids, or  the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. is a sample container used for quality control purposes or for testing by regulatory officials.

National Sentence Text: The storage cabinets referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: The cabinets and rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall not be located above or below the first storey.

National Sentence Text: Not more than 30 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 10 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in each dwelling unit. (See Sentence 4.1.1.1. for oil-burning appliances.)
P/T Sentence Text: No more than 30 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 10 L may be Class I liquids, may be stored in a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.2.5.4.(2), in mercantile occupancies, the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from or into containers shall only be permitted in a storage room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9. (See Note A-4.2.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from or into containers shall take place in a storage room that complies with Subsection 4.2.9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(2), the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids outside of a cabinet or storage room required in Article 4.2.6.2. is permitted, provided such storage does not exceed 10 L, including not more than 5 L of Class I liquids, in a single room, or 250 L, including not more than 60 L of Class II liquids, or 10 L of Class I liquids, in a single fire compartment with a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids outside of a cabinet or room required in Article 4.2.6.2. is permitted, provided such storage does not exceed  10 L, including not more than 5 L of Class I liquid, in a single room, or  250 L, including no more than 60 L of Class II liquid, or 10 L of Class I liquid, in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or storage rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.

National Sentence Text: The clearances required in Sentence 4.2.11.1. do not apply where not more than 5 000 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored adjacent to a building on the same property, provided that either the building is limited to 1 storey in building height and is used primarily for the storage or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or the exposed wall has a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h and has no openings within 3 m of such outdoor storage.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearances required in Sentence  do not apply where not more than 5000 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored adjacent to a building on the same property, and  the building is 1 storey in building height and used primarily for the storage or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or  the exposed wall has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h and has no openings within 3 m of such outdoor storage.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity permitted in the pile shall be equal to that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.
P/T Sentence Text: If two or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity in the pile shall be equal to the maximum quantity permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in self-service storage buildings within the scope of Section 3.9. of Division B of the NBC.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
National Sentence Text: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with API 620-2013 Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Article Title: Low pressure storage tanks and pressure vessels
P/T Sentence Text: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with  API 620, Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks , or  ASME BPVC, Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code .

National Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
National Sentence Text: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code
P/T Article Title: Low pressure storage tanks and pressure vessels
P/T Sentence Text: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA-B51, "Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code".

National Sentence Text: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CPPI, "Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification" or to CAN/CGSB-24.3, "Identification of Piping Systems".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Tight-filled storage tanks shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing a positive shut-off device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (See Note A-4.3.1.8.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tight-filled storage tank shall be prevented from being overfilled with a positive shut-off device that complies with CAN/ULC-S661, "Standard for Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.5.3.(2), 2 or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , two or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.

National Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank that is below the liquid level and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Each connection that is located below the liquid level of the aboveground storage tank and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.

National Sentence Text: Where the contained space created by the secondary containment is not accessible for an internal visual examination, and the secondary containment is not sloped so as to permit liquid to flow to a specific location that can be monitored, a monitoring device shall be provided to indicate the loss of integrity of the secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text: The secondary containment shall be equipped with a monitoring device that activates a visual or audible alarm in an attended area in the event of a loss of integrity of the secondary containment unless  the contained space created by the secondary containment is accessible for an internal visual examination, and  the secondary containment is sloped so that liquid would flow to a specific location that can be monitored.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks installed underground shall be of double-walled construction and shall be built in conformance with the underground storage tank standards identified in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , underground storage tanks shall be double-walled and shall be built in accordance with the underground storage tank standards in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.8.3.(3), storage tanks subjected to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , underground storage tanks subject to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping shall be tested for leaks at the commissioning stage in conformance with Clause 4.4.1.2.(1)(a).
P/T Sentence Text: At the time of installation, underground storage tanks and associated piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A dispenser sump shall be provided under a dispenser, unless the dispenser is located on top of an aboveground storage tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Spill containment sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C58.19-1992 Spill Containment Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except at distilleries covered in Section 4.10., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.5.2., 4.5.3. and 4.5.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except at distilleries as provided in Section 4.9., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.4.2., 4.4.3. and 4.4.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.11.4.(2), where vent piping connects 2 or more storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , if vent piping connects two or more underground storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.

National Sentence Text: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa  at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa  at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.

National Sentence Text: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.
P/T Sentence Text: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid and vapour tight.

National Sentence Text: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practicable to the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practical to the tank.

National Sentence Text: Pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air shall not be performed on storage tanks and piping systems having once contained flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on storage tanks with flammable liquids or combustible liquids in the tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leak detection testing in areas where explosive mixtures of flammable liquid or combustible liquid vapours and air may be present in the vicinity of a storage tank that has been in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leakage testing where explosive mixtures of vapours from flammable liquids or combustible liquids and air may be present in the area of a tank that has been in use.

National Sentence Text: Investigative action shall be undertaken if the inventory reconciliation described in Sentence 4.4.2.1. indicates the following inexplicable conditions: a monthly loss of 0.5 percent or more of the throughput from an underground storage tank, or 1.0 percent or more of the throughput from an aboveground storage tank, three consecutive losses greater than 200 L/day, and a water level greater than 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: A comparison of the measurements described in Sentences  and  with meter readings and a computation of any gain or loss of liquid shall be done each time a required measurement is taken.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.1.1. and except as otherwise specified in this Code, this Section provides the minimum requirements regarding the detection of leaks in aboveground and underground storage tanks, piping systems and sumps.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Materials for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made of materials that are suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.

National Sentence Text: Non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Non-metallic piping systems may be used for underground installations if they comply with CAN/ULC-S660, "Standard for Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: If a precision leak detection test referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1. detects a leak rate exceeding 0.38 L/h on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In the case of underground storage tanks or piping, the test referred to in Sentence 4.4.3.2. shall be conducted prior to covering the tank or piping system.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Test devices and methods shall conform to the performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-16 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to CAN/ULC-S642, "Standard for Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence , flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in accordance with ASME B16.5, "Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings NPS ½ "Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard".

National Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-16 Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.
P/T Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to "ASTM A193/A193M, "Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications", Grade B-7.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical connections in underground piping systems shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, not be in direct contact with the soil, and be provided within a transition sump.
P/T Sentence Text: Where underground piping systems have no secondary containment, mechanical connections shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, and not be in direct contact with the soil.

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components connected to the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the test procedure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components included in the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the remainder of the system.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing piping systems, except that pressure piping normally containing Class I liquids is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.
P/T Article Title: Class I liquids as a test medium
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing of piping systems, except that piping normally containing Class I liquids under pressure is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.

National Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows and doors.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping passing though the secondary containment walls of an aboveground storage tank shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping passing through secondary containment walls shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.

National Sentence Text: Piping passing under railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC 2001 Standards Respecting Pipeline Crossings Under Railways
P/T Sentence Text: Piping passing under railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC, "Standards Respecting Pipeline Crossings Under Railways".

National Sentence Text: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system conforming to Subsection 4.1.6. shall be provided.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping in trenches referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.9. shall be covered with noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Noncombustible material shall be used to cover piping referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11. shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence  shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.

National Sentence Text: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.

National Sentence Text: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.
P/T Sentence Text: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.

National Sentence Text: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the Building Code.

National Sentence Text: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.

National Sentence Text: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence 4.5.9.3. shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.
P/T Sentence Text: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence  shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred by water pressure as a result of displacement, such system shall not be used for liquids that are miscible in water.
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred by water pressure as a result of displacement, such system shall not be used for liquids that are miscible in water.

National Sentence Text: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5. shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Sentence Text: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence  shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC, "Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code".

National Sentence Text: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent backflow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent back-flow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence 4.5.10.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: All penetrations into a sump shall be situated at least 50 mm from the bottom of the sump. (See Note A-4.5.5.7.(1).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in closed containers, in conformance with Article 4.7.2.4., or storage tanks, in conformance with Section 4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in closed containers in conformance with Article 4.6.2.4., or storage tanks in conformance with Section 4.3.
