National Sentence Text: In the design of the piping system, provisions shall be made for the expansion, contraction, vibration, settling and temperature changes of piping in accordance with Article 4.5.6.14.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.

National Sentence Text: Where a dispenser referred to in Sentence 4.7.3.2. is supplied from an aboveground storage tank an automatically operated valve that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated shall be provided at the tank outlet, and an emergency valve shall be provided for the dispenser in conformance with Sentence 4.6.6.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a dispenser referred to in Sentence  is supplied from an aboveground storage tank, an automatically operated valve, that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated, shall be provided at the tank outlet, and an emergency valve that complies with CAN/ULC-S651, "Standard for Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids" shall be installed in the supply line so that the shear point of the valve is not higher than the base of the dispenser and not lower than 25 mm below the base of the dispenser.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A device to shut off power to all dispensers and pumps shall be provided at a remote location on the site of the fuel-dispensing station and shielded from any fire that might occur in the dispensing area.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When the flow of liquid can be stopped other than by the hose nozzle valve, a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is permitted to be used only if it is provided with a device that will automatically close the hose nozzle valve upon a drop of pressure in the dispensing hose.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Instructions for the operation of dispensers in self-service outlets shall be posted in a conspicuous location.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At fuel-dispensing stations that provide both attended service and self-service, the attendant required in Sentence 4.6.8.1. is permitted to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids at the attended service island, provided that each island has an emergency shut-off switch as described in Article 4.6.4.2., and the attendant is never more than 25 m from the self-service island or control console.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A telephone or other clearly identified means to notify the fire department shall be provided in a location readily accessible to the user.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Every person dispensing flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall take precautions to prevent overflow or spillage of the liquid being dispensed, not knowingly overfill the fuel system, except as otherwise stated in Article 4.6.8.5., in the event of spillage, immediately apply an absorbent material to soak up the spillage in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3., not dispense Class I or II liquids in proximity to open sources of ignition, not use any object or device that is not an integral part of the hose nozzle valve assembly to maintain the flow of fuel, and not dispense the liquids into containers that are in a vehicle, watercraft or floatplane.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be constructed of heavy timber or material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.
P/T Sentence Text: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be of heavy timber construction or other material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.

National Sentence Text: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.
P/T Sentence Text: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.

National Sentence Text: Operating personnel shall be trained on how to summon the nearest fire department in the event of fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Operating personnel shall be trained in how to summon the nearest fire department in the event of fire.

National Sentence Text: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.

National Sentence Text: The transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids between tanks of marine vessels and piers or wharves shall be through flexible cargo hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a)), or jointed tubing or piping suitable for the cargo to be transferred, and designed to withstand the maximum design working pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: The transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids between tanks of marine vessels and piers or wharves shall be through flexible cargo hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice, or jointed tubing or piping suitable for the cargo to be transferred, and designed to withstand the maximum design working pressure.

National Sentence Text: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon its disconnection, the hose shall be drained so as not to create a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon disconnection of the hose, the hose shall be drained so as to not create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: Process plants where Class I and II liquids are handled shall not have basements or covered pits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.1.5.9., Class I liquids shall not be handled or used in basements.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68, "Standard on Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting", or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69, "Standard on Explosion Prevention Systems".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.10.2.1.(2), buildings or parts of buildings in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high-hazard industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , buildings or parts thereof in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high hazard industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Where more than 25 000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than 25000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Emergency procedures conforming to Article 4.1.5.5. shall be established for refineries and process plants.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.10.8.1.(2), in maturing warehouses, at least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 4-A:30-B:C shall be located adjacent to each exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , in maturing warehouses, at least one 4A:30B:C rated portable extinguisher shall be located adjacent to each exit.

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by fire separations conforming to this Code and the NBC, but having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment, mechanical systems, piping, valves, and automatic and manual control and safety devices shall be inspected, tested and maintained in good operating condition at all times.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical equipment, mechanical systems, piping, valves and automatic and manual control and safety devices shall be inspected annually and maintained in good operating condition at all times.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.4.3.(2), the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. shall conform to Article 6.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 4.12.8.3. shall  conform to NFPA 91, Standard for Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids ,  provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of explosive vapours or of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system,  confine flammable vapours to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors,  not return the exhausted air to the building, and  be provided with well identified control switches that are  located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and  readily accessible in case of an emergency.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where combustible or reactive deposits can accumulate in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard, provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or an automatic fire suppression system shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where deposits referred to in Clause  can accumulate in the power-ventilated exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard,  provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or  an automatic special fire suppression system shall be provided in conformance with an applicable standard set out in Article 6.8.1.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Part applies to processes and operations that involve a risk from explosion, high flammability or related conditions that create a hazard to life safety.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to materials, processes and operations that involve a risk from explosion or high flammability, or otherwise create a hazard to life safety or health.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the NBC and with this Part.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the Building Code and the requirements of this Part.

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
Conveying equipment bearings shall be accessible for inspection and maintenance, lubricated to prevent overheating, and kept free of accumulation of combustible dusts.
Nozzles for standpipe and hose systems shall conform to Sentence 3.2.5.11. of Division B of the NBC.
Dangerous goods shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.13.
Where combustible materials, such as packaging materials, are used in a laboratory, their quantity shall not be greater than the supply for one day of normal operation.

An ignition source that is an integral part of an operation involving flammable vapours shall be permitted provided the supply of flammable liquids or combustible liquids for this operation is controlled and kept to a strict minimum, flammable vapours and combustion fumes are exhausted in conformance with Article 5.5.4.2., there is no other source of ignition capable of igniting the flammable vapours in an uncontrolled manner, and there is no combustible material in the immediate vicinity of this operation.
The ventilation system described in Sentence 5.5.4.3. shall not be interlocked with a fire detection, fire alarm or make-up air system.
Valves on cylinders for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be closed when not in use.

Except as permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.3.(7), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases of pyrophoric materials shall be located in a gas storage cabinet that is continuously mechanically ventilated, and sprinklered.

National Article Title: Fire Separations in Partly Occupied Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where part of a building continues to be occupied, the occupied part shall be separated from the part being demolished or constructed by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Article Title: Storage and Use of Dangerous Goods
National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods shall be used in conformance with Part 5.

Where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases are stored outdoors, they shall be supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms, and located in an enclosure fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders containing compressed gases stored outdoors shall be  supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms,  located in an enclosure used for the sole purpose of such storage, and  surrounded by a fence in conformance with Sentence 5.6.2.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: Existing gas, electrical, water, steam and other services are permitted to be left within the area of the excavation provided that before work begins, the service company concerned has approved the proposed method of operation, the location of the services is determined before excavation commences, a suitable method of excavation is adopted that will ensure that the services are not damaged, and the services are provided with suitable temporary supports.
This Section shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to buildings, parts of buildings or equipment where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.4.(2), a dust collector having a capacity greater than 2.36 m3/s shall be located outside of a building, and be equipped with explosion venting to the outdoors of not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , a dust collector shall be located outside of a building.

National Sentence Text: When air exhausted by a dust collector described in this Article is returned to a building, the dust-collecting system shall be designed so that returned air will not create an explosion hazard inside the building, and the exhaust fan and ancillary equipment are automatically shut down in the event of a fire or an explosion inside the dust collector.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dust collectors described in Sentence , when air exhausted by a dust collector is returned to a building, the dust-collecting system shall be designed so that  returned air will not create an explosion hazard inside the building, and  the exhaust fan and ancillary equipment are automatically shut down in the event of a fire or an explosion inside the dust collector.

National Sentence Text: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with NFPA 69, "Standard on Explosion Prevention Systems".

National Sentence Text: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.

National Sentence Text: Operations or machines that generate sparks or combustible vapours shall not be served by exhaust systems connected to woodworking machines referred to in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1).
P/T Article Title: Operations that produce sparks or combustible vapours
P/T Sentence Text: A machine that produces sawdust, particles or shavings shall not be used in an operation that generates sparks or combustible vapours.

National Sentence Text: Operations or machines that generate sparks or combustible vapours shall not be served by exhaust systems connected to woodworking machines referred to in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1).
P/T Article Title: Operations that produce sparks or combustible vapours
P/T Sentence Text: An exhaust system shall not serve an operation that generates sparks or combustible vapours.

National Sentence Text: Loose shavings and sawdust shall be collected at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Article 2.4.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Loose sawdust, particles or shavings shall be swept up at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3).

National Sentence Text: A portable extinguisher shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine producing wood dust, particles or shavings.
P/T Sentence Text: A portable extinguisher that complies with Subsection 6.2.6. or a garden-type hose shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine that produces sawdust, particles or shavings.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: Any combustible and flammable material, dust or residue shall be removed from the area where hot work is carried out, or except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(2), protected against ignition by the use of noncombustible materials.
P/T Sentence Text: If there is a possibility of sparks, flames or heat igniting combustible materials as a result of hot surface applications  combustibles within 5 m of the hot surface application shall be protected against ignition, and  openings in roofs, parapets or other building structures within 5 m of hot surface applications shall be covered or closed to prevent the passage of sparks or flames to adjacent areas.

National Sentence Text: Facilities shall be provided to enable the watcher referred to in Sentences 5.6.1.14.(1)and 5.6.1.14. to ensure a fire warning is sounded to notify occupants, and communicate with the fire department.

This Subsection applies to processes in which products or materials are immersed in a dip tank containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the unatomized application of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, such as by flow coating or roll coating processes.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to flow-coating operations using flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation required in Sentence 5.4.4.3. is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation required in Sentence  is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.

National Sentence Text: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.
P/T Sentence Text: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.1.(2), hot work shall be carried out in an area free of combustible and flammable contents, with walls, ceilings and floors of noncombustible construction or lined with noncombustible materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Hot work operations in buildings shall be carried out in areas that  are free of combustible and flammable contents, and  have walls, ceilings and floors of noncombustible construction or that are lined with noncombustible materials.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.
P/T Sentence Text: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.

National Sentence Text: At least one portable fire extinguisher shall be provided in the hot work area.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher conforming to Section 6.2 shall be provided in the hot work area.

National Sentence Text: This Part includes requirements for the inspection, testing, maintenance, and operation of portable extinguishers, water-based fire protection systems, special extinguishing systems, fire alarm systems, emergency electrical power supply systems, emergency lighting, and exit signs.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to installation, checking, inspection, testing, maintenance and operation of fire protection equipment and life safety systems.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings except dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Section 6.2 does not apply to dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operable condition at all times.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operating condition.

National Sentence Text: Loudspeakers operated from the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure they can be heard in all parts of the building.
Liquid fuel storage tanks shall be drained and refilled with fresh fuel at intervals not greater than 12 months. (See Note A-6.5.1.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Liquid fuel storage tanks shall be drained and refilled with fresh fuel at intervals not greater than 12 months.

National Sentence Text: Except where a building is provided with a fire alarm system or similar equipment, a watch, with tours at intervals of not more than 1 h, shall be provided when a portion of the building is occupied while construction operations are taking place.
P/T Sentence Text: If a firewatch is required, the demolition site shall be toured by firewatch personnel at least once each hour.

National Sentence Text: In areas of a building where construction, alteration or demolition operations are taking place, at least one exit shall be accessible and usable at all times.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise approved, at least two exits shall be accessible and usable at all times.

National Sentence Text: Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except in a retirement home, storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.1.8.3. shall terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where it abuts on or intersects a floor, a roof slab, or a roof deck.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence  shall terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where it abuts on or intersects,  a floor,  a roof slab, or  a roof deck.

National Sentence Text: If a door is installed such that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.
P/T Sentence Text: If a door is installed so that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper shall be installed in the plane of the fire separation so as to stay in place should the duct become dislodged during a fire. (See Note A-3.1.8.10.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper shall be installed in the plane of the fire separation so as to stay in place should the duct be dislodged during a fire. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Area Limits for Wired Glass and Glass Block
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.19., the maximum area of wired glass in a door used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.17. shall conform to the Table. (See Note A-3.1.8.18.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 3.1.8.16. Area Limits for Wired Glass and Glass Block
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of wired glass in a door used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15. shall conform to the Table. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Area Limits for Wired Glass and Glass Block
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.19., the maximum area of glass block and wired glass panels not in a door, used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.17., shall conform to the Table.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.8.16. Area Limits for Wired Glass and Glass Block
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of glass block and wired glass panels not in a door, used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table.

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.

National Article Title: Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
National Sentence Text: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
P/T Article Title: 3.1.9.3. Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
P/T Sentence Text: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.9.4.(2), outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Sentence , outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by, a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.

National Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation provided it is not located in a vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible piping that is part of a system described in Sentence  shall not be located in a vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material or assembly shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies if the material or assembly is designed for use in a relatively horizontal position with only its top surface exposed to air, cannot be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.12.1. without the use of supporting material that is not representative of the intended installation, or is thermoplastic.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material or assembly shall be determined on the basis of no fewer than three tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102.2, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies", if the material or assembly, is designed for use in a relatively horizontal position with only its top surface exposed to air, cannot be tested in conformance with Sentence  without the use of supporting material that is not representative of the intended installation, or is thermoplastic.

National Sentence Text: A material, assembly, or structural member is permitted to be assigned a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification on the basis of .
P/T Sentence Text: A material, assembly, or structural member is permitted to be assigned a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification on the basis of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.3-07 Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses, have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102.2, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies", fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC-S102.3, "Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses", are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S107-10 Fire Tests of Roof Coverings
P/T Sentence Text: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with CAN/ULC-S107, "Fire Tests of Roof Coverings". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system referred to in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of brick, masonry, concrete, metal sheets or metal shingles.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for, a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area, provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system described in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of metal sheets, metal shingles or other noncombustible roofing materials.

National Sentence Text: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence 3.2.2.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence .

National Sentence Text: A building is considered to face 3 streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.
P/T Sentence Text: A building is considered to face three streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.

National Sentence Text: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.

National Sentence Text: If Sentence 3.2.2.16. permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.
P/T Sentence Text: If Sentence  permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.

National Sentence Text: Except for a building containing one or 2 dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a building containing one or two dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within, 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8. are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence  are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.2.3.14. does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered throughout, but shall apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.3.14. Wall Exposed to Another Wall (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered, but shall apply to, unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.

National Sentence Text: If a second manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated not less than 4 times.
P/T Sentence Text: If a second manual pull station or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence , in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated no fewer than four times.

National Sentence Text: A fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated, it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than, 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.

National Sentence Text: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and Sentence 3.2.4.7. does not apply, a legible notice that is not easily removed shall be affixed to the wall near each manual station stating that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or for the fire department (see Note A-3.2.4.7.(5)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered, and Sentence  does not apply, a legible notice, that is not easily removed, shall be affixed to the wall near each manual pull station stating, that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or the telephone number of the fire department. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(3), in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.

National Sentence Text: In a 2-stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.
P/T Sentence Text: In a two stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.

National Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion thereof in which they are installed. (See Note A-3.2.4.19.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentences 3.2.4.19. and 3.2.4.20. and  shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion of it in which they are installed. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.20. and permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: (0.1) Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.22A., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article. Except as permitted by Sentence , smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, care and treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(13), a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.

National Article Title: Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings
National Sentence Text: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall continue to emit a visible signal while voice instructions are being transmitted.
P/T Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence  shall be designed so that visual signal devices are not interrupted while voice instructions are being transmitted.

National Article Title: Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: A voice communication system referred to in Sentence  that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over the system shall include a pre-recorded message.

National Sentence Text: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: A voice communication system required by Sentence  that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over loudspeakers described in Sentence  shall include a pre-recorded message.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.13. and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling, provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence  and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 3.2.7.1. shall be not less than 10 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence  shall not be less than 10 1x.

National Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.10. to emergency lighting units in the same storey need not conform to Sentence 3.2.7.10.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence  to emergency lighting units in the same storey need not conform to Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10. between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.
P/T Sentence Text: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence  to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence  between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.

National Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure that is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least two means of egress.

National Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey provided the corridor does not serve a care, care and treatment, detention or residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13. shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence  shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

National Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of, laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Sentence Text: Glass in doors and in sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in doors and glass sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.2.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.25. shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to an industrial occupancy where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , aisles shall be located so that there are not more than seven seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.

National Sentence Text: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5. shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum clear width of each aisle shall be measured at the point in the aisle furthest from, an egress doorway referred to in Clause (a), an exit referred to in Clause (b), or an exit referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5. shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for an aisle serving bleacher seats, where rows of seats discharge into an aisle, the minimum clear width required by Sentence  shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of length of the aisle measured in the direction towards an exit.

National Sentence Text: Dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide two equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleacher seats shall be provided with intermediate construction so that there is no opening that would permit the passage of a sphere of more than 100 mm in diameter.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleachers shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.13. is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence  is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with, a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13 "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.

National Sentence Text: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall not be located above or below the first storey of the building.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(5), fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence  shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A room intended for the storage of reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids and Combustible
National Sentence Text: Fire separations for rooms where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored are required to be constructed with a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. of Division B of the NFC.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tire storage area intended for the storage of more than 375 m3 of tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Interior Finishes, Furnishings and Decorative Materials
National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC.
Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
A party wall shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
Hose connections shall be provided with sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.
Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.19. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.18. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.

National Sentence Text: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to the appropriate requirements for stairs serving interconnected floor spaces in Article 3.2.8.4.

National Sentence Text: Doors shall be installed so that, when open, they do not diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Exit doors shall be hung so that, when open, they shall neither diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit by more than 50 mm for each door leaf.

National Sentence Text: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.

National Sentence Text: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence 3.4.4.4. shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence  shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.

National Article Title: Slip Resistance of Ramps and Stairs
National Sentence Text: The surfaces of ramps, and landings and treads shall have a finish that is slip resistant, and if accessible to the public, shall have either a colour contrast or a distinctive pattern to demarcate the leading edge of the tread and the leading edge of the landing, as well as the beginning and end of a ramp.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.1. Surface Finish of Ramps and Stairs
P/T Sentence Text: The surfaces of ramps, landings and treads shall, have a finish that is slip-resistant, and if accessible to the public, have a colour contrast or a distinctive visual pattern to demarcate, the leading edge of the tread, the leading edge of the landing, and the beginning and end of a ramp.

National Article Title: Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required Landings
National Sentence Text: No flight of stairs shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight of stairs serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.
P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.3. Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required Landings
P/T Sentence Text: No flight shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.

National Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on each side of stairs that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights of any width, and ramps.
P/T Sentence Text: One handrail shall be provided on each side of, straight flights that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights, and ramps.

National Sentence Text: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.
P/T Sentence Text: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.

National Sentence Text: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from, a line drawn through the outside edges of the tread nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(10), the top of the nosing of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , the top of the nosing of a stair tread shall have a rounded or bevelled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.

National Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the size of openings that exceed this limit does not present a hazard, there shall be no opening that permits the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 100 mm through a guard for a fire escape.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence  shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

National Sentence Text: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained therein.
P/T Sentence Text: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained in any of them.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a roof-top appliance and the building it serves.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire separation is not required between a rooftop appliance and the building it serves.

National Sentence Text: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent which has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.
P/T Sentence Text: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent that, has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.7.2.1.(2), if the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: When the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.3.(2), at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or 2 water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional 2 water closets or urinals.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in this Subsection, at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or two water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional two water closets or urinals.

National Sentence Text: Wall and floor surfaces below the uppermost surfaces of a urinal shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance from the urinal to a point not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the urinal on to the wall or floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall and floor surfaces below the uppermost surfaces of urinals shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance from the urinal to a point not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the urinal on to the wall or floor.

National Article Title: Access to Storeys Served by Escalators and Moving Walks
National Sentence Text: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall also be provided to that floor level. (See Note A-3.8.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to that floor level. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: In an assembly occupancy, the number of spaces designated for wheelchair use within rooms or areas with fixed seats shall conform to Table 3.8.2.3. (See also Article 3.8.3.21. for additional requirements.)
P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.1. Areas Requiring Barrier-Free Path of Travel
P/T Sentence Text: In an assembly occupancy with fixed seats, the minimum number of spaces designated for wheelchair use and the minimum number of fixed seats designated for adaptable seating shall conform to Table 3.8.2.1. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The number of water closets required in a suite of mercantile occupancy whose area is not more than 500 m2 is permitted to be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.2.2.-B based solely on the total number of staff.

National Article Title: Access to Parking Areas and Exterior Passenger-Loading Zones
National Sentence Text: Exterior passenger-loading zones shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
Only the active leaf in a multiple leaf door in a barrier-free path of travel need conform to the requirements of this Article.
At least one water-closet stall or enclosure in a washroom required to be barrier-free shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
Where urinals are provided in a barrier-free washroom, at least one urinal shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
The requirements in Part 3 regarding occupant load shall not apply to self-service storage buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements based on occupant load shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: Tents not more than 120 m2 in ground area, located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided this does not create a hazard to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.

National Sentence Text: The electrical system and equipment in a tent or air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: The electrical system and equipment in a tent, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: The electrical system and equipment in a tent or air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: The electrical system and equipment in an air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: All permanent and temporary structural members, including the formwork and falsework of a building, shall be protected against loads exceeding the specified loads during the construction period except when, as verified by analysis or test, temporary overloading of a structural member would result in no impairment of that member or any other member.
P/T Sentence Text: All permanent and temporary structural members, including formwork and falsework of a building, shall be protected against loads exceeding the specified loads during the construction period except when, as verified by analysis or test, temporary overloading of a structural member would result in no impairment of that member or any other member.

National Sentence Text: The lateral deflection of buildings due to service wind and gravity loads shall be checked to ensure that structural elements and non-structural elements whose nature is known at the time the structural design is carried out will not be damaged.
P/T Sentence Text: The lateral deflection of buildings due to service wind and gravity loads shall be checked to ensure that structural elements and non-structural elements whose nature is known at the time the structural design is carried out will not be damaged.

National Article Title: Loads on Exterior Areas (See Note A-4.1.5.5.)
National Sentence Text: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.

National Article Title: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
National Sentence Text: The minimum specified load due to equipment, machinery or other objects that may produce impact shall be the sum of the weight of the equipment or machinery and its maximum lifting capacity, multiplied by an appropriate factor listed in Table 4.1.5.11.
P/T Article Title: 4.1.5.11.  Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum specified load due to equipment, machinery or other objects that may produce impact shall be the sum of the weight of the equipment or machinery and its maximum lifting capacity, multiplied by an appropriate factor listed in Table 4.1.5.11.

National Article Title: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
National Sentence Text: Crane runway structures shall be designed to resist a horizontal force applied normal to the top of the rails equal to not less than 20% of the sum of the weights of the lifted load and the crane trolley (excluding other parts of the crane).
P/T Article Title: 4.1.5.11.  Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Crane runway structures shall be designed to resist a horizontal force applied normal to the top of the rails equal to not less than 20% of the sum of the weights of the lifted load and the crane trolley, excluding other parts of the crane.

National Sentence Text: Bleachers shall be checked by the erector after erection to ensure that all structural members, including bracing specified in the design, have been installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Bleachers shall be checked by the erector after erection to ensure that all structural members, including bracing specified in the design, have been installed.

National Sentence Text: Telescopic bleachers shall be provided with locking devices to ensure stability while in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Telescopic bleachers shall be provided with locking devices to ensure stability while in use.

National Sentence Text: Under fire conditions, where the fire-resistance rating of the structure is less than that of the firewall, lateral support shall be assumed to be provided by the structure on one side only, or another structural support system capable of resisting the loads imposed by a fire on either side of the firewall shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Under fire conditions, where the fire-resistance rating of the structure is less than that of the firewall,  lateral support shall be assumed to be provided by the structure on one side only, or  another structural support system capable of resisting the loads imposed by a fire on either side of the firewall shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.

National Sentence Text: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load given in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.
P/T Sentence Text: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.

National Sentence Text: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.

National Sentence Text: For all gable roofs, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.
P/T Sentence Text: For all gable roofs, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.

National Article Title: Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes
National Sentence Text: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.6.10.
P/T Article Title: 4.1.6.10. Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes
P/T Sentence Text: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.6.10.

National Sentence Text: Earthquake forces shall be assumed to act horizontally and independently about any two orthogonal axes.
P/T Sentence Text: Earthquake forces shall be assumed to act horizontally and independently about any two orthogonal axes.

National Sentence Text: Post-disaster buildings shall not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 9 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6., have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.
