P/T Sentence Text: Post-disaster buildings shall,  not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5 and 7 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35,  not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6.,  have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and  have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.

National Article Title: Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying
National Sentence Text: The higher mode factor, Mv, and its associated base overturning moment reduction factor, J, shall conform to Table 4.1.8.11.
P/T Article Title: 4.1.8.11. Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures
P/T Sentence Text: The higher mode factor, Mv, and its associated base overturning moment reduction factor, J, shall conform to Tables 4.1.8.11.A. to 4.1.8.11.E.

National Sentence Text: Adjacent structures shall be separated by a distance equal to at least the square root of the sum of the squares of their individual deflections calculated in Sentence 4.1.8.13.(2), or connected to each other.
P/T Sentence Text: Adjacent structures shall be,  separated by a distance equal to at least the square root of the sum of the squares of their individual deflections calculated in Sentence 4.1.8.13.(2), or  connected to each other.

National Sentence Text: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Note A-4.1.8.15.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Foundation displacements and rotations shall be considered as required by Sentence 4.1.8.16.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation displacements and rotations shall be considered as required by Sentence 4.1.8.16.(1).

National Article Title: Elements of Structures, Non-structural Components and Equipment
National Sentence Text: When the mass of a tank plus its contents or the mass of a flexible or flexibly connected piece of machinery, fixture or equipment is greater than 10% of the mass of the supporting floor, the lateral forces shall be determined by rational analysis.
P/T Sentence Text: When the mass of a tank plus its contents or the mass of a flexible or flexibly connected piece of machinery, fixture or equipment is greater than 10% of the mass of the supporting floor, the lateral forces shall be determined by rational analysis.

National Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.
P/T Sentence Text: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.

National Sentence Text: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.

National Sentence Text: All structural framing elements shall be designed for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd   1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.
P/T Sentence Text: All structural framing elements shall be designed,  for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence  with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd Ã¢â°Â¥ 1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or  for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence  with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.

National Sentence Text: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.

National Sentence Text: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Note A-4.2.4.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the professional engineer responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.
P/T Sentence Text: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the person responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.

National Sentence Text: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
P/T Sentence Text: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

National Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared by a person especially qualified in this field of work in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and 4.2.5.2.

National Sentence Text: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.
P/T Sentence Text: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.

National Sentence Text: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.
P/T Sentence Text: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.

National Sentence Text: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall have sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to the intended use of the building, and the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected.
P/T Sentence Text: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall be designed and constructed to provide sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate, all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to,  the intended use of the building, and  the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and  all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may be reasonably expected.

National Article Title:
5.2.2.1.
Determination of Structural Loads and Effects
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.1. and their related effects shall include dead loads transferred from structural elements, wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function (see Note A-5.2.2.1.(2)(c)), live loads due to use and occupancy, and loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.
P/T Article Title: 5.2.2.1. Determination of Structural Loads and Effects
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence  and their related effects shall include, dead loads transferred from structural elements,  wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures,  earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function, (See Appendix A.)  live loads due to use and occupancy, and  loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or a means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of water away from building assemblies, and the provision of means for drainage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of surface water away from building assemblies and the provision of means for drainage.

National Sentence Text: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms
P/T Sentence Text: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848, "Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms".

National Sentence Text: The weighted normalized flanking level difference shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms
P/T Sentence Text: The weighted normalized flanking level difference shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848, "Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms".

National Sentence Text: Other fenestration assemblies using metal framing that separate interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.
P/T Sentence Text: Other fenestration assemblies that are metal-framed and separate interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building

National Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems and equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Asbestos shall not be used in heating, ventilating or air-conditioning systems or equipment.

National Sentence Text: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.

Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies, may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outside, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10. and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.
Where ducts penetrate fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building, they shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , duct penetration of fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.

National Sentence Text: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.
P/T Sentence Text: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of make-up air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14. Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy nor in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed,  adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the service room, and  in the service room.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices to indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.
P/T Sentence Text: A ventilation system required in this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices that, indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and  sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.

National Sentence Text: This Part applies to the design, construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , this Part applies to the design and construction of plumbing.

National Article Title: Conformance with Regulations or National Plumbing Code
National Sentence Text: Every plumbing system shall be designed and installed in conformance with appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NPC.

Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.
P/T Sentence Text: Aggregates shall, consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction", and  be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than, 32 MPa for garage floors, carport floors and all exterior flatwork,  20 MPa for interior floors other than those for garages and carports, and  15 MPa for all other applications.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and  all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.

National Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is protected in accordance with Use Category 1 or Use Category 2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be, protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and  separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.
P/T Sentence Text: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material required in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material, and in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.

National Article Title: Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads
National Sentence Text: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.4.2.3.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.4.2.3. Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads
P/T Sentence Text: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a house or an individual dwelling unit. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.2.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.1.
Variation Label: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

National Sentence Text: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that they resist snow loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist snow loads.

National Sentence Text: Storm doors for sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist wind loads, control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and be easily operable.
P/T Sentence Text: Storm doors, sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they, resist wind loads,  control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m,  resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and  are easily operable.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in SentenceÃ  and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the run shall comply with Table 9.8.4.2.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.2. Dimensions for Runs and Rectangular Treads (See A-9.8.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The run for rectangular treads shall conform to Table 9.8.4.1.
Variation Label: Dimensions for Runs and Rectangular Treads

National Article Title: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5. and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 9.8.4.5., where a flight within a house or individual dwelling unit consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
Variation Label: Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads

National Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a door at the top of a stair in a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.

National Sentence Text: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be,  not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, or  not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width, where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths.

National Sentence Text: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Guards are not required, at loading docks,  at floor pits in repair garages, or  where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high.
P/T Sentence Text: All guards within dwelling units, other than guards serving spiral stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every means of egress except, exits that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit, and  access to exits within a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Means of Egress Except those Serving a house or Individual Dwelling Unit

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within or serving an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3. that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.
P/T Sentence Text: In doorways described in Sentence  that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and  no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.

National Article Title: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, and doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a single dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6. and Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.6.7. Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
P/T Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit and except for doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation.
Variation Label: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms

National Article Title: Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms and Contained
National Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least 2 separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.7.1. Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least two separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3. and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1), where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to two separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.

National Article Title: Signs for Stairs and Ramps at Exit Level
National Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit, if the portion beyond the exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.11.4. Signs for Stairs and Ramps at Exit Level
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings that are 3 storeys in building height, any part of an exit ramp or stairway that continues up or down past the lowest exit level shall be clearly marked to indicate that it does not lead to an exit where the portion below exit level may be mistaken as the direction of exit travel.

National Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3. shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.
P/T Sentence Text: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence  shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.

National Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".

National Sentence Text: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Part 6.

National Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to in this Part as a "surface flame-spread rating", it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.

National Sentence Text: Interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
P/T Sentence Text: Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.

National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space exceeds 1 800 mm in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings except between rooms and spaces within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire.

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop system that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: In buildings containing 2 dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: In a house containing two dwelling units, combustible piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(4), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.11.2., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.11.2. and 9.10.11.4., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall.

National Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4. that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4. do not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence  that is at the edge of an attic or roof space, and completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence  do not apply.

National Sentence Text: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.
P/T Sentence Text: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.12.

National Sentence Text: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also Article 6.3.1.7.)
P/T Sentence Text: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation.

National Article Title: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
National Sentence Text: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.15. Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
Variation Label: Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(2), where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be, taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a house, and  calculated as,  the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling,  the area for each fire compartment where a house is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or  where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine maximum area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling.
Variation Label: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.1. Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each stair where the stair passes through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Sentence Text: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.
P/T Sentence Text: A central vacuum cleaning system serving more than one suite or storey in a building equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.

National Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3. is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.
P/T Sentence Text: Where access to a building as required in Sentence  is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.

National Sentence Text: Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Each building in a camp for housing of workers shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the provisions of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2. do not apply to foundations for buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, and whose superstructure conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes or accessory buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, not more than 1 storey in height, not more than 55 m2 in building area, and where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the floor joists is not more than 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The foundation depths required in Sentence  do not apply to foundations for,  buildings,  that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, and  whose superstructure conforms with the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1, "Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes", or  accessory buildings,  that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction,  not more than 1 storey in building height,  not more than 55 mÃÂ² in building area, and  where the distance from the finished ground to the underside of the floor joists is not more than 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence  and Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.

National Sentence Text: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and no pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).
P/T Sentence Text: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing, not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and  no pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

National Sentence Text: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with the remainder of this Section, or CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1, "Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes", the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with, this Section, or  CSA Z240.10.1, "Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of 100 mm, or the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.
P/T Sentence Text: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of, 100 mm, or  the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if such walls support a solid masonry superstructure, the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if, such walls support solid masonry superstructure,  the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or  the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.

National Sentence Text: Where the beam referred to in Sentence 9.15.5.2. is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the beam referred to in Sentence  is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.

National Sentence Text: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.
P/T Sentence Text: Granular material need not be installed under, slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or  buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained in the occupancy permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(2), steel pipe columns shall have an outside diameter of not less than 73 mm and a wall thickness of not less than 4.76 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , steel pipe columns shall have an outside diameter of not less than 73 mm and a wall thickness of not less than 4.76 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.

National Sentence Text: Steel columns other than those described in Sentence 9.17.3.4. shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
P/T Article Title: 9.17.3.4. Design of Adjustable Steel Columns (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Adjustable steel columns other than those described in Sentence  shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units conforming to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units, conforming to CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units", and  having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

National Sentence Text: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 mÃÂ² of unobstructed vent area for every 50 mÃÂ² of floor area.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.2.(2), the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/300 of the insulated ceiling area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the unobstructed vent area shall be not less than 1/300 of the insulated ceiling area.

National Sentence Text: The hatch required in Sentence 9.19.2.1. shall be not less than 550 mm by 900 mm except that, where the hatch serves not more than one dwelling unit, the hatch may be reduced to 0.32 m2 in area with no dimension less than 500 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where an attic or roof space contains a fuel-fired appliance, the hatch required in Sentence  shall be not less than 550 mm by 900 mm except that, where the hatch serves a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, the hatch may be reduced to, 0.32 m2 in area with no dimension less than 545 mm, or  500 mm by 700 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Masonry units shall comply with ASTM C 73-10 Calcium Silicate Brick (Sand-Lime ASTM C 126-13 Ceramic Glazed Structural Clay Facing Tile, Facing Brick, and Solid Masonry Units ASTM C 212-14 Structural Clay Facing Tile CSA CAN/CSA-A82-14 Fired Masonry Brick Made from Clay or Shale CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units CSA A165.2-14 Concrete Brick Masonry Units or CSA A165.3-14 Prefaced Concrete Masonry Units
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry units shall comply with, ASTM C73, "Calcium Silicate Brick (Sand-Lime Brick)",  ASTM C126, "Ceramic Glazed Structural Clay Facing Tile, Facing Brick, and Solid Masonry Units",  ASTM C212, "Structural Clay Facing Tile",  CAN/CSA-A82 "Fire Masonry Brick Made from Clay or Shale",  CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units",  CSA A165.2, "Concrete Brick Masonry Units", or  CSA A165.3, "Prefaced Concrete Masonry Units".

National Sentence Text: Mortar types shall be in accordance with Table 9.20.3.2.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar types shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.A.

National Sentence Text: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls may be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Note A-9.20.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls are permitted to be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2. and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.7.2. and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one-third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.

National Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.20.8.1. may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence  may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.

National Sentence Text: Floor joists described in Sentence 9.20.8.2. shall not project into the cavity.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists described in Sentence  shall not project into the cavity.

National Article Title: Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Note A-9.20.8.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.20.8.5. Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one-third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
National Sentence Text: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence 9.20.8.5. is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.8.5. Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
P/T Sentence Text: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence  is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and  the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.

National Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall, be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and be staggered from course to course.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall, extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall,  be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and  be staggered from course to course.

National Sentence Text: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4. shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence  shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.

National Sentence Text: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of 2 corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 200 mm or less in height, and installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of two corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide, spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 190 mm or less in height, and  installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 190 mm.

National Sentence Text: Reinforcement required in Sentence 9.20.9.6. shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Reinforcement required in Sentence  shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

National Sentence Text: In applying Sentence 9.20.10.1.(2), the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or the thickness of the thicker wythe.
P/T Sentence Text: In applying Sentence , the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of, two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or  the thickness of the thicker wythe.

National Article Title: Anchorage to Floor or Roof Assemblies where Masonry Walls Require
National Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1. shall be shaped to provide a mechanical key with the masonry and shall be securely fastened to the horizontal support to develop the full strength of the anchor.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.1. Anchorage of Floor or Roof Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence  shall be shaped to provide a mechanical key with the masonry and shall be securely fastened to the horizontal support to develop the full strength of the anchor.

National Article Title: Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: Wood-frame walls shall be anchored to masonry walls that they intersect with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.3. Wood Frame Walls Intersecting Masonry Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Wood frame walls shall be tied to intersecting masonry walls with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.
Variation Label: Wood Frame Walls Intersecting Masonry Walls

National Sentence Text: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1. shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The units referred to in Sentence  shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25Ã mm and the total projection does not exceed one-third of the total wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: In situations described in Sentence , flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for wall openings located less than 150 mm above ground level, where a concealed flashing is not installed beneath window and door sills, such sills shall be provided with an outward slope and a drip located not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.

National Article Title: Laying Temperature of Mortar and Masonry
National Sentence Text: No frozen material shall be used in mortar mix.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.14.1. Laying Temperature of Mortar and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material shall be used in the mortar mix.

National Article Title: Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Floor joists and building frames supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.5. Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form
P/T Sentence Text: Floor joists and building frames supported on top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2. for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.2.2. Connections of More Than One Appliance
P/T Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence  for a solid fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.

National Sentence Text: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue Liners
P/T Sentence Text: Clay liners shall conform to CAN/CSA-A324-M, "Clay Flue Liners".

National Article Title: Spaces between Liners and Surrounding Masonry
National Sentence Text: The space required in Sentence 9.21.3.8. shall not be filled with mortar.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.3.8. Spaces Between Liners and Surrounding Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: The space required in Sentence  shall not be filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 70 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible flooring, subflooring and ceiling finishes shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.

National Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace or a steel fireplace liner, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces".

National Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than, 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and  an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be at least 300 mm above the top of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace Inserts
P/T Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC-S628, "Fireplace Inserts".

National Article Title: Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates
National Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level. (See also Article 9.23.2.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be, levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or  laid directly on the foundation where the top of the foundation is level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(8), where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence 9.23.9.2. and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence  and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.

National Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided,  the studs are clad on at least one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and  the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , wall plates shall be, not less than 38 mm thick, and  not less than the required width of the wall studs.

National Article Title: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
National Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.13.7. Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
P/T Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts may be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.

National Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8. need not comply with Sentence 9.23.14.8. where the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence  need not comply with Sentence  where, the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and  the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of cladding materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of siding materials.

National Sentence Text: The openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7. shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.
P/T Sentence Text: The openings described in Sentence  shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board at least 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.

National Sentence Text: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor, if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than a 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.

National Sentence Text: Insulation located in areas where it may be subject to mechanical damage shall be protected by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , insulation and vapour barrier shall be protected from mechanical damage by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be, sealed with compatible material such as tape or flexible sealant, or  except as required by Sentence , lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking and rigid panels.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall to become an exterior floor,  the air barrier of the wall under the floor shall be continuous with or sealed to the subfloor or the air barrier on the underside of the floor,  the air barrier of the wall above the floor shall be continuous with or sealed to the subfloor or the air barrier on the top of the floor, and  the spaces between floor joists shall be blocked and sealed.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or 2 layers of roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Open valleys shall be flashed with,  at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or  no fewer than two layers of roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3. shall consist of at least Type S smooth roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.
P/T Sentence Text: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence  shall consist of not less than Type S smooth roll roofing or TypeÃ M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
National Sentence Text: Flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5. shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.5. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls Other Than
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing required in Sentence  shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
National Sentence Text: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5. shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.5. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls Other Than
P/T Sentence Text: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence  shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.

National Article Title: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
National Sentence Text: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1).
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.7. Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls Other Than
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.26.4.8. at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence  at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.

National Sentence Text: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.
P/T Sentence Text: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of, No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement,  Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement,  glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or  self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.

National Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Coverage shall be not less than two thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.
P/T Sentence Text: Decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.

National Sentence Text: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm nor more than 350 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a watertight joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a water-tight joint.
