National Article Title: Group A, Division 1, One Storey, Limited Area, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 1 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.21. provided  except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 1 storey in building height,  it has less than 40% of the area of the building as 2 storeys for the purpose of  development of productions, including preparation of scenery and costumes and rehearsal of performers,  organization of performers, scenery and sound equipment,  preparation by performers for a performance,  managerial functions, or  toilets, rest rooms and similar public facilities,  it has no occupancy above or below the auditorium other than one which serves it or is dependent on it,  it is not more than 600 m2 in building area, and  the occupant load is not more than 600.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.21. Group A, Division 1, 1 Storey, Limited Area
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 1 is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  it is not more than 1 storey in building height,  it has less than 40% of the area of the building as 2 storeys for the purpose of,  development of productions including preparation of scenery and costumes and rehearsal of performers,  organization of performers, scenery and sound equipment,  preparation by performers for a performance,  managerial functions, or  toilets, rest rooms and similar public facilities,  it has no occupancy above or below the auditorium other than one that serves it or is dependent on it,  it is not more than 600 m2 in building area, and  the occupant load is not more than 600.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 2, up to 6 Storeys, Any Area, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group A, Division 2, that is not limited by building area, is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.24.(2), provided  except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, and  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.24. Group A, Division 2, up to 6 Storeys, Any Area, Sprinklered
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 2, that is not limited by building area, is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, and  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys
National Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.32. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is constructed as a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., and the building area is not more than 1 200 m2 if facing one street, 1 500 m2 if facing 2 streets , or 1 800 m2 if facing 3 streets , and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.25. Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys
P/T Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence  is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less 45 min, roof assemblies shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is constructed as a fire-retardant treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., and the building area is not more than, 800 m2 if facing one street, 1 000 m2 if facing two streets, or 1 200 m2 if facing three streets, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction, used singly or in combination, provided  except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and  it has a building area not more than  2 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height with no basement,  1 200 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or  600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.27. Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than, 2 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height with no basement, 1 200 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 3, One Storey, Increased Area
National Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.32. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is constructed as a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., and the building area is not more than 1 200 m2 if facing one street, 1 500 m2 if facing 2 streets , or 1 800 m2 if facing 3 streets , and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.32. Group A, Division 3, 1 Storey, Increased Area
P/T Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence  is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is constructed as a fire-retardant treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., and the building area is not more than, 1 200 m2 if facing one street, 1 500 m2 if facing two streets, or 1 800 m2 if facing three streets, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

National Article Title: Group A, Division 3, One Storey, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2 .
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2.

National Article Title: Group C, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group C is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.50.(2), provided  it is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height,  it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and  it has a building area not more than  9 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height,  4 500 m2 if 2 storeys in building height,  3 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height,  2 250 m2 if 4 storeys in building height,  1 800 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or  1 500 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.43A. Group C, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered, Combustible
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  it is sprinklered,  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height,  it has a height of not more than 18 m, measured between the floor level of the first storey and the floor level of the uppermost storey or mezzanine that is not a rooftop enclosure, provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, and  it has a building area of not more than,  9 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height,  4 500 m2 if 2 storeys in building height,  3 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height,  2 250 m2 if 4 storeys in building height,  1 800 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or  1 500 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.

National Article Title: Group D, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.58.(2), provided  it is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height,  it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and  it has a building area not more than  18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height,  9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height,  6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height,  4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height,  3 600 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or  3 000 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.50A. Group D, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered, Combustible
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  it is sprinklered,  it is not more than 6 storeys in building height,  it has a height of not more than 18 m, measured between the floor level of the first storey and the floor level of the uppermost storey or mezzanine that is not a rooftop enclosure, provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, and  it has a building area of not more than,  18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height,  9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height,  6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height,  4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height,  3 600 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or  3 000 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.

National Article Title: Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Increased Area, Sprinklered
National Sentence Text: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided  except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout,  it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and  it has a building area not more than  18 000 m2 if1 storey in building height,  9 000 m2 if2 storeys in building height,  6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or  4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.69. Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Increased Area
P/T Sentence Text: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and  it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.69.A. or Table 3.2.2.69.B.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.8. and in addition to the requirements of Sentences 3.2.3.7. and 3.2.3.7. and where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is greater than 10% of the exposing building face, foamed plastic insulation used in an exterior wall of a building more than 3 storeys in building height shall be protected on its exterior surface by  concrete or masonry not less than 25 mm thick, or  noncombustible material that complies with the criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance stated in Sentence 3.2.3.8. when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence  and in addition to the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.7. and where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is greater than 10% of the exposing building face, foamed plastic insulation used in an exterior wall of a building more than 3 storeys in building height shall be protected on its exterior surface by,  concrete or masonry not less than 25 mm thick, or  noncombustible material that complies with the criteria for testing and conditions of acceptance of Sentence  when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8. are that  the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m,  the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints,  the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed,  the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and  the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Clause  are that,  the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m,  the exposed surface will include typical vertical and horizontal joints,  the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed,  the noncombustible protective material will remain in place and no through openings will develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and  the noncombustible protective material will not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.

National Sentence Text: A single stage fire alarm system installed in a building of assembly occupancy that has an occupant load more than 300 shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence , that an alarm signal has been initiated.
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire alarm system is required to be installed and a single stage system is provided, the system shall be designed to notify the fire department in conformance with Sentence  that an alarm signal has been initiated in,  a Group A occupancy having an occupant load more than 300,  a Group B occupancy,  a Group F, Division 1 occupancy,  a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6.,  a building containing interconnected floor space required to conform to Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11., or  a retirement home.

National Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required in Sentence 3.2.4.11. shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by the elevator machine room in which the smoke detector is installed.
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke detectors required by Clause  shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by machinery located in the machine room or machinery space in which the smoke detector is installed.

National Sentence Text: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that  alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and  alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations, and where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.4.20. Audibility of Alarm Systems (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.19. and except as required by Clause 3.2.4.4.(2)(d), audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that,  alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and  alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations and, where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area.

National Sentence Text: If a 2-stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)
P/T Article Title: 3.2.4.20. Audibility of Alarm Systems (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: If a two stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence , the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage.

National Article Title: Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings
National Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22. shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than  10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or  30 s for all other occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence  shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a two-stage fire alarm system while voice messages are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than,  10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or  30 s for all other occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered throughout and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.

National Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys.

National Sentence Text: Key-operated switches for emergency recall required by Sentence 3.2.6.4. shall be provided in a conspicuous location at  each elevator lobby on the recall level, and  the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Key-operated switches for emergency recall described by Sentence  shall be provided in a conspicuous location at,  each elevator lobby on the recall level, and  the central alarm and control facility required in Article 3.2.6.7.

National Sentence Text: Each elevator for use by firefighters shall  be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S104-15 Fire Tests of Door Assemblies  be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or  be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where Measure K of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings", is used, each elevator for use by firefighters shall,  be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in CAN/ULC-S104, "Fire Tests of Door Assemblies",  be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or  be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Electrical conductors for the operation of the elevator referred to in Sentence 3.2.6.5. shall be installed in service spaces conforming to part 3. that do not contain other combustible material, or protected against exposure to fire from the service entrance of the emergency power supply, or the normal service entrance of the normal power supply, to the equipment served, to ensure operation for a period of 1 h when subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials (see Note A-3.2.6.5.(6)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical conductors for the operation of the elevator referred to in Sentence  shall be, installed in service spaces conforming to Section 3.6. that do not contain other combustible material, or protected against exposure to fire from the service entrance of the emergency power supply, or the normal service entrance of the normal power supply, to the equipment served, to ensure operation for a period of 1 h when subjected to the standard fire exposure described in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 9.34.2.

National Article Title: Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be supplied from  a generator,  batteries, or  a combination thereof.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.7.8. Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence  shall be supplied from,  a generator,  batteries, or  a combination of the items described in Clauses  and (b).

National Article Title: Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be capable of providing supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following that period, emergency power under full load for not less than 2 h for a building within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building classified as a Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of part 3., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building.
P/T Article Title: 3.2.7.8. Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
P/T Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by Sentence  shall be capable of providing, supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following, emergency power under full load for not less than, 2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building classified as Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., (ii.1) 1 h for a building that contains a Group C major occupancy retirement home and that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by Sentence 3.2.7.10. and permitted by this Article, electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10. shall  conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h (see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2) and 3(a)), or  be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence  and except as permitted in this Article, electrical conductors referred to in Sentence  shall,  conform to CAN/ULC-S139, "Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables", including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h, or  be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall, terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11.

National Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.8. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.
P/T Sentence Text: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.

National Sentence Text: The required exit width for exit stairs that serve interconnected floor space designed in accordance with Articles 3.28.3. to 3.2.8.8. shall be cumulative, unless  the stairs provide not less than 0.3 m2 of area of treads and landings for each occupant of the interconnected floor space (see Note A-3.4.3.2.(6)(a)), or  protected floor spaces conforming to Article 3.2.8.5. are provided at each floor level and the protected floor space on a floor level has not less than 0.5 m2 of space for each occupant of that floor level of the interconnected floor space. (See Note A-3.4.3.2.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence  need not be applied where the exit stairs that serve interconnected floor spaces are designed so that the required width of each stair is cumulative.

National Sentence Text: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A smoke control system conforming to Sentences  to  shall be designed to control the movement of smoke within a building containing an interconnected floor space.

National Sentence Text: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A mechanical exhaust shall be provided to remove air at the top of an interconnected floor space at the rate of at least six air changes per hour, except that where the volume of the interconnected floor space exceeds 17 000 m3, only four air changes per hour need be provided.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: A balcony required by Clause  shall  have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area  be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and  provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: A balcony required by Sentence  shall,  be provided with a door way having a clear width of not less that 800 mm when the door is in the open position,  have no projection above the walking surface more than 13 mm,  be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and  provide not less than 0.5 m2 for each occupant of the suite.

National Sentence Text: The length of travel to an exit door by any aisle shall be not more than 45m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a seating area is separated as required by Sentences 3.3.2.2. and  or 3.3.2.2.(8), the length of travel by any aisle shall be not more than 45 m measured from the most remote point of the aisle to, an egress doorway in the required separation, or an exit leading directly from the seating area.

National Sentence Text: The length of travel to an exit door by any aisle shall be not more than 45m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a seating area is not required to be separated by Sentences 3.3.2.2. and  or 3.3.2.2.(8), the travel distance shall be not more than 45 m measured from the most remote point of the aisle to an exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3), a floor area described in Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall be divided into not less than 2 fire compartments, each not more than 1000 m2 in area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a floor area containing patients or residents sleeping rooms in a hospital or long-term care home shall be divided into no fewer than two fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.3.5. to 3.3.3.5.(13), walls between patients or residents sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless one is required by other provisions in this Part. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , walls between patients or residents sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless a fire-resistance rating is required by other provisions in this Part.

National Sentence Text: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms and intensive care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be  separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and  provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.3.6. Protection for Special Care and Treatment Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms, intensive care units and critical care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be, separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and  provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.

National Sentence Text: Single storey dwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey immediately above, and immediately below.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , single storey dwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey, immediately above, and immediately below.

National Article Title: Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for Dwelling
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8
P/T Article Title: 3.3.4.7. Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and interior guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102.4, Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways, (FT6 rating).

The requirements for a roof assembly to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived for a gymnasium, a swimming pool, an arena, or a rink if no part of the roof assembly is less than 6 m above the main floor or balcony and the roof carries no loads other than normal roof loads, including permanent access walks, and ventilating, sound and lighting equipment, except that the restriction concerning minimum distance shall not apply to  an inclined and stepped floor ascending from the main floor which is used for seating purposes only, or  a balcony used for seating purposes only.
Fire detectors required by Sentence  shall be installed in elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts where a sprinkler system is not installed within the hoistway or shaft.
Except as permitted by Sentence , 64 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in a standpipe system.

Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to part 3.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to Subsection 3.4.7.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one half of the required number of exits from any floor area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one-half of the required number of exits from any floor area.

National Sentence Text: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60, and  in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.-A, or  in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout  the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and  the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60 and,  in a floor area that is not sprinklered, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.A., or  in a floor area that is sprinklered,  the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and  the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.B.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.2.1. and 3.4.2.1. are permitted to be waived for dwelling units that have an access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4. to 3.3.4.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences  and  are permitted to be waived for dwelling units having access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4. to  and .

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.4.3.2. and 3.4.3.2.(6), the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving 2 or more floor areas located one above the other.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence , the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving two or more floor areas located one above the other.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.3. and 3.4.3.3.(4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  to , no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.

National Sentence Text: Every exit sign shall  be visible on approach to the exit,  consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols Safety colours and safety signs Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and  conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols Safety colours and safety signs Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)):  E001 emergency exit left,  E002 emergency exit right,  E005 90-degree directional arrow, and  E006 45-degree directional arrow.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided by Sentence , every exit sign shall,  be visible on approach to the exit,  consist of a green pictogram and white graphic symbol meeting the visibility specifications referred to in ISO 3864 1, "Graphical Symbols " Safety Colours and Safety Signs â¬" Part 1: Design Principles for Safety Signs and Safety Markings", and  conform to ISO 7010, "Graphical Symbols - Safety Colours and Safety Signs - Registered Safety Signs" for the following symbols:  E001 emergency exit left,  E002 emergency exit right,  E005 90-degree directional arrow, and  E006 45-degree directional arrow.

National Sentence Text: Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side, where  there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and  the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side where,  the difference in level is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or  the adjacent surface within 1 200 mm of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2 away from the walking surface.

National Sentence Text: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit and except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.12. and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall  open in the direction of exit travel, and  swing on its vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  to  and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall,  open in the direction of exit travel, and  swing on its vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be remotely released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13., and except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.16. and 3.4.6.16. and Article 3.4.6.17., locking, latching and other fastening devices on a principal entrance door to a building as well as those on every exit door shall include release hardware complying with Sentence 3.8.3.8. to permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12., and except as permitted by Sentence , locking, latching and other fastening devices on every exit door shall permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall  be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts,  be not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.7 mm above the surface,  be located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and  be contrasting in colour with the surface to which they are applied (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d)).
P/T Sentence Text: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall  be mounted permanently on each side of doors to exit stair shafts,  be not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.7 mm above the surface,  be located 1 500 mm from the finished floor, and  be contrasting in colour with the surface to which they are applied.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for  the floor assembly above the storey, or  the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for,  the floor assembly above the storey, or  the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separation referred to in Sentence .
P/T Sentence Text: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separations surrounding the electrical equipment vault.

National Sentence Text: Electrical equipment vaults shall be secured against unauthoroized entry.
P/T Sentence Text: Each door to an electrical equipment vault shall be provided with a substantial lock or padlock.

National Sentence Text: The floor of an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence  shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , the floor of the electrical equipment vault described in Sentences  and  shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Fire Separations for Horizontal Service Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., a horizontal service space that penetrates a required vertical fire separation shall be separated from the remainder of the building it serves in conformance with Sentence .
P/T Article Title: 3.6.4.2. Fire Separations for Horizontal Service Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., a horizontal service space that penetrates a required vertical fire separation shall be separated from the remainder of the building it serves in conformance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: If a concealed space referred to in Sentence  is used as a return-air plenum and incorporates a ceiling membrane that forms part of the required fire-resistance rating of the assembly, every opening through the membrane shall be protected by a fire stop flap that  stops the flow of air into the concealed space in the event of a fire,  is supported in a manner that will maintain the integrity of the ceiling membrane for the duration of time required to provide the required fire-resistance rating,  conforms to ULC CAN/ULC-S112.2 Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies and  activates at a temperature approximately 30Â°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the return-air plenum, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: If a concealed space referred to in Sentence  is used as a return-air plenum and incorporates a ceiling membrane that forms part of the required fire-resistance rating of the assembly, every opening through the membrane shall be protected by a fire stop flap that shall,  stop the flow of air into the concealed space in the event of a fire,  be supported in a manner that will maintain the integrity of the ceiling membrane for the duration of time required to provide the required fire-resistance rating,  conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, "Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies", and  activate at a temperature approximately 30ÃÂ°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the return-air plenum, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Article Title: Security for Banks and Mercantile Areas
National Sentence Text: Exit and egress doors referred to in Sentence  shall be designed to prevent locking at anytime that the part of the floor area that they serve is open to the public.

National Article Title: Security for Banks and Mercantile Areas
National Sentence Text: In exit and egress facilities referred to in Sentence , at least one door at each exit and egress location shall  be operable in conformance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1), or  be equipped with locks conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16. that release immediately  if an alert signal or alarm signal is initiated in the fire alarm system, or  the sprinkler system is actuated.

National Article Title: Security for Banks and Mercantile Areas
National Sentence Text: Travel distance to an exit referred to in Sentence  shall not exceed the travel distance determined in accordance with Subsection 3.4.2.

A fuel-fired appliance installedon the roof of a building or in another location outside the building shall be installed not less than  1.2 m from a propertyline, measured horizontally, and  3 m from an adjacent wall of the same building if that wall contains any opening within 3 storeys above and 5 m horizontally from the appliance, unless every opening within these limits is protected by  a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min determined in accordance with Article 3.1.8.4., or  a wired glass assembly permitted for use in a vertical fire separation anddescribedin D-2.3.15. in Appendix D.

Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.2.(4), water closets shall be provided for each sex assuming that the occupant load is equally divided between males and females, unless the proportion of each sex expected in the building can be determined with reasonable accuracy. (See Note A-3.7.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Subsection, water closets shall be provided for each sex assuming that the occupant load is equally divided between males and females, unless the proportion of each sex expected in the building can be determined with reasonable accuracy.

National Sentence Text: Lavatories required by Sentence 3.7.2.3. shall be equipped with faucets that operate automatically, or have a manual control that complies with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1), does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, lavatories required by Sentence  shall be equipped with faucets that, operate automatically, or have a manual control that, has a lever type handle or is otherwise operable with a closed fist, does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the number of water closets required for a care or residential occupancy shall be at least one for each 10 persons of each sex.
P/T Article Title: 3.7.4.6. Plumbing Fixtures for Other Residential Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units and as provided in Sentence , the number of water closets required for residential occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , the number of water closets required for a mercantile occupancy shall be atleast one for each 300 males and one for each 150 females.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the number of water closets required for the public in mercantile occupancies shall be at least one fixture for each 300 males and one fixture for each 150 females, except that,  water closets provided for employees are permitted to be counted as part of those required for the public when these water closets are made accessible to the public, and  where the total area of the mercantile occupancy, excluding basements, is not more than 600 m2, not more than one water closet for each sex need be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a washroom in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required in accordance with Article 3.8.2.3., shall be barrier-free in accordance with Subsection 3.8.3.(See Note A-3.8.2.8. to .)
P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.3. Washrooms Required to be Barrier-Free (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: A barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to barrier-free washrooms designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.12.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence , a washroom in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required in accordance with Article 3.8.2.3., shall be barrier-free in accordance with Subsection 3.8.3.(See Note A-3.8.2.8. to .)
P/T Article Title: 3.8.2.3. Washrooms Required to be Barrier-Free (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence , where washrooms in excess of those required by Subsection 3.7.4. are provided in a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, the additional washrooms shall be designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements of, Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11., or Article 3.8.3.12.

National Sentence Text: A passenger-elevating device referred to in Article 3.8.2.3. shall conform to CSA B355 Lifts for Persons with Physical Disabilities
P/T Sentence Text: A passenger elevating device referred to in Article 3.8.2.1. shall conform to CSA B355, "Lifts for Persons with Physical Disabilities".

National Sentence Text: Drinking fountains required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall  be located along a barrier-free path of travel,  have a minimum clear floor space of 800 mm by 1 350 mm in front of it,  where it has frontal access, provide a knee clearance in accordance with Sentence 3.8.3.15.(1),  have a spout that  is located near the front of the unit, at a height between 750 mm and 915 mm above the floor, and  directs water flow in a trajectory that is nearly parallel to the front of the unit, at a height not less than 100 mm, and  be equipped with controls that  activate automatically, or  are located either on the front or on both sides of it and comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: A barrier-free drinking fountain shall,  have a spout located near the front of the unit not more than 915 mm above the finished floor,  be equipped with controls that are easily operated from a wheelchair using one hand with a force of not more than 22 N or shall operate automatically,  project the water at least 100 mm high,  provide the water stream at a vertical angle of up to,  30°, where the spout is located less than 75 mm from the front of the fountain, or  15°, where the spout is located not less than 75 mm and not more than 125 mm from the front of the fountain,  be detectable by a cane at a level at or below 680 mm from the finished floor, and  where the drinking fountain is cantilevered, meet the following requirements:  be mounted not more than 915 mm above the finished floor,  provide a clearance height under the fountain of not less than 735 mm above the finished floor,  have a clear depth under the fountain of not less than 450 mm,  have a clear width under the fountain of not less than 760 mm,  have a toe clearance height under the fountain of at least 350 mm above the finished floor from a point 300 mm back from the front edge to the wall, and  have a depth at the base of the fountain of at least 700 mm.

National Sentence Text: Drinking fountains required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall  be located along a barrier-free path of travel,  have a minimum clear floor space of 800 mm by 1 350 mm in front of it,  where it has frontal access, provide a knee clearance in accordance with Sentence 3.8.3.15.(1),  have a spout that  is located near the front of the unit, at a height between 750 mm and 915 mm above the floor, and  directs water flow in a trajectory that is nearly parallel to the front of the unit, at a height not less than 100 mm, and  be equipped with controls that  activate automatically, or  are located either on the front or on both sides of it and comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: A barrier-free drinking fountain required by Sentence  shall have a clear floor space in front of, or adjacent to, the fountain that is a minimum of 810 mm deep and 1 370 mm wide

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentence  do not apply to an individual suite having an area less than 500 m2 in a building havingonly suites of assembly, care, business and personal services or mercantile occupancy if the suite is completely separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building.
Except as provided in Sentences 3.9.3.1. to 3.9.3.1.(6), the requirements of Section 3.3 shall apply. (See Note A-3.9.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , the requirements in Section 3.3. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Subsection 3.2.3.need not apply between buildings within a group of self-service storage buildings, where the distance between these buildings is at least 6 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance between individual buildings within a group shall be not less than 6 m.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to Sections 3.3 and 3.4
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , tents shall conform to Sections 3.3. and 3.4.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures  shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences  and , and  shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences ,  and , tents shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other tents or structures on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures not occupied by the public  need not be separated from one another, and  are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property provided this spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property, where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures  shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences  and , and  shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences ,  and , air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property or to the property line.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures not occupied by the public  need not be separated from one another, and  are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property provided this spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected closer than 3 m from other structures on the same property where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the building occupants or the public.

National Sentence Text: Where a building or structural member can be expected to be subjected to loads, forces or other effects not listed in Article 4.1.2.1., such effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most appropriate information available.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or structural member can be expected to be subjected to loads, forces or other effects not listed in Article 4.1.2.1., such effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most appropriate information available.

National Sentence Text: A building and its structural components shall be designed to have sufficient strength and stability so that the factored resistance, fR, is greater than or equal to the effect of factored loads, which shall be determined in accordance with Sentence .
P/T Sentence Text: A building and its structural components shall be designed to have sufficient strength and stability so that the factored resistance, fR, is greater than or equal to the effect of factored loads, which shall be determined in accordance with Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the total drift per storey under service wind and gravity loads shall not exceed 1/500 of the storey height unless other drift limits are specified in the design standards referenced in part 4. (See Note A-4.1.3.5.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the total drift per storey under service wind and gravity loads shall not exceed 1/500 of the storey height unless other drift limits are specified in the design standards referenced in Section 4.3. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , in areas of a building where partitions, other than permanent partitions are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , in areas of a building where partitions other than permanent partitions are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.

National Article Title: Loads Due to Use of Floors and Roofs
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the specified live load on an area of floor or roof depends on the intended use and occupancy, and shall not be less than either the uniformly distributed load patterns listed in Article 4.1.5.3., the loads due to the intended use and occupancy, or the concentrated loads listed in Article 4.1.5.9., whichever produces the most critical effect. (See Note A-4.1.5.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 4.1.5.1. Loads Due to Use of Floors and Roofs
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the specified live load on an area of floor or roof depends on the intended use and occupancy, and shall not be less than whichever of the following loads produces the most critical effect:  the uniformly distributed load patterns listed in Article 4.1.5.3.,  the loads due to the intended use and occupancy, or  the concentrated loads listed in Article 4.1.5.9. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of the probable assembly of persons, the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and the probable storage of materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of,  the probable assembly of persons,  the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and  the probable storage of materials.

National Article Title: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
National Sentence Text: The force described in Sentence  shall be equally distributed on each side of the runway and shall be assumed to act in either direction.
P/T Article Title: 4.1.5.11.  Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The force described in Sentence  shall be equally distributed on each side of the runway and shall be assumed to act in either direction.

National Article Title: Loads on Walls Acting As Guards

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure, "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system, "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system, "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads, "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system, and  "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein:  "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure,  "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system,  "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system,  "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads,  "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system, and  "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.

National Sentence Text: Every seismically isolated structure and every portion thereof shall be analyzed and designed in accordance with,  the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.20.,  other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and  appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.19.(2))

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein:  "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and  "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Clause  shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.1.and construction conforming to that design.

National Sentence Text: A vapour barrier is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled vapour diffusion will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.

National Sentence Text: The vapour barrier shall have sufficiently low permeance and shall be positioned in the building component or assembly so as to minimize moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, or reduce moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, to a rate that will not allow sufficient accumulation of moisture to cause deterioration or otherwise adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services.
