National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space (see Note A-9.7.4.2.(1)), resist wind loads, control air leakage, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they, resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space,  resist wind loads,  control air leakage,  resist the ingress of insects and vermin,  where required, resist forced entry, and  are easily operable, unless they are fixed units.

National Article Title: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
National Sentence Text: Strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.5.2. Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence  shall be fastened, to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or  to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long.
Variation Label: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors

National Article Title: Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.6.1. Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CAN/CSA-A440.4, "Window, Door, and Skylight Installation", except that, shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be of treated plywood, and  protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.

National Article Title: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
National Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.4.4. Uniformity and Tolerances for Risers, Runs and Treads
P/T Sentence Text: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight described in Sentence , the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences ,  and  and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided, at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages,  at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, and  where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp.

National Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90Â°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.8.6.3. Dimensions of Landings (See A-3.4.6.4. in Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where the landing in a stair or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90ÃÂº, the length of the landing shall not be less than the lesser of, the required width of the stair or ramp, or  1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.7.1. to 9.8.7.1.(4), handrails shall be installed on stairs and ramps in accordance with Table 9.8.7.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , a handrail shall be installed on stairs and ramps in conformance with TableÃ 9.8.7.1.

National Sentence Text: Except for stairs and ramps serving only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces and for exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units , where the width and spacing of balusters are such that 3 balusters can be engaged by a load imposed over a 300 mm width, the load shall be imposed so as to engage 3 balusters.
P/T Sentence Text: For guards within dwelling units and in exterior guards serving not more than 2 dwelling units, where the width and spacing of pickets are such that three pickets can be engaged by a load imposed over a 300 mm width, the load shall be imposed so as to engage three pickets.

National Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.12.

National Sentence Text: Doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.1. and 9.9.6.1.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences  and .

National Sentence Text: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence  provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.
P/T Sentence Text: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence  provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading.

National Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence  and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence  and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6. or 9.9.8.6.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than,  40 m in a business and personal services occupancy,  45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered provided it does not contain a high hazard industrial occupancy, or  30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clause  or (b).

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by, an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or  an exit doorway not more than 1 500 mm above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17. and 3.2.5.18.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.18. and 3.2.5.19.

National Article Title: Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy
National Sentence Text: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1. and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies .
P/T Article Title: 9.10.2.4. Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy
P/T Sentence Text: In a building containing more than 1 major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.2.3. and 9.10.8.1. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.

National Sentence Text: The requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for roofs that support an occupancy, the requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and  the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8. and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence .
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or other similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence .

National Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2 .
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence , provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cmÃÂ².

National Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence , provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80, Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives, or specifically designed with a fire stop.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence , provided the fire damper is,  installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives," or  designed specifically with a fire stop.

National Sentence Text: Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in Sentence 9.10.9.14. where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietorâs residence and do not contain cooking facilities.
P/T Sentence Text: Sleeping rooms in boarding, lodging or rooming houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 30 min where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietorÃ¢â¬â¢s residence and do not contain cooking facilities.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17. and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  and , a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.5.(1), 9.33.5.2. and 9.33.5.3.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence , where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.4. and 9.33.1.2.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances and service water heaters need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence  where the equipment serves, not more than one room or suite,  a house, or  a building, other than a house, with a building area of not more than 400 mÃÂ² and a building height of not more than 2 storeys.
Variation Label: Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service

National Sentence Text: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence  do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements in Sentence  do not apply provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

National Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5. shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2 .
P/T Sentence Text: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence  shall not exceed 0.8 mÃÂ² in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 mÃÂ².

National Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.4. to 9.10.14.4.(10), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.14.4.-A, conform to part 3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall, conform to Table 9.10.14.4.,  conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or  where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than,  the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low hazard industrial occupancies, and  half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium hazard industrial occupancies.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.4.(6), the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.15.4., conform to part 3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.15.4. Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , the maximum area of glazed openings in an exposing building face shall, conform to Table 9.10.15.4.,  conform to Subsection 3.2.3. as if the glazed openings were unprotected openings, or  where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared.
Variation Label: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks described in Sentence  are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.16.2. Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Fire blocks required in Sentence  need not be provided, if, the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space and the horizontal thickness of that air space is not more than 25 mm,  the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, or  the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25.
Variation Label: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences  and , fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences  and , fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

National Sentence Text: Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences  and .
P/T Sentence Text: Doors within dwelling units, other than vehicle garage doors, need not conform to Sentences  and .

National Sentence Text: Within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.19.3. Location of Smoke Alarms (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that, there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and  on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed,  in each sleeping room, and  in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence  need not be provided in buildings containing only dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, or houses with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Access panels required in Sentence  need not be provided in houses.

National Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence  may also be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Access required in Sentence  is also permitted to be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in construction camps shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 min fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in a building in a camp for housing of workers shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 min fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.

National Sentence Text: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2 , or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with, concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or  gypsum board finish that,  is supported on wood or steel framing, and  ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce the heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to part 9. coved over the footing.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6Ã mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing.

National Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.

National Article Title: Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
National Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with part 4.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.3. Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
P/T Sentence Text: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences 9.15.3.4. and 9.15.3.4.(2), and Articles 9.15.3.5. and 9.15.3.6., and the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences 9.15.3.4. and 9.15.3.4. and Article 9.15.3.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences  and , and ArticlesÃ 9.15.3.5. and 9.15.3.6., and  the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences  and , and ArticleÃ 9.15.3.7.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-B and Sentences  to , where the walls are laterally supported at the top, average stable soils are encountered, and wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.B. and Sentences  to  where,  the walls are laterally supported at the top,  average stable soils are encountered, and  wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: Sentences 9.15.4.3. to 9.15.4.3. pertain to lateral support for walls described in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(1).
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: Sentences  to  apply to lateral support for walls described in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: When floor drains are required (see part 9.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.
P/T Sentence Text: When floor drains are required, the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.

National Sentence Text: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: The ground cover required in Sentence  shall have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and be sealed and evenly weighted down, or be covered with concrete not less than 50 mm thick.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.2. Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: The ground cover required in Sentence  shall, have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and sealed and weighted down, or  be covered with a concrete skim coat not less than 50 mm thick.

National Article Title: Concrete Blocks Exposed to the Weather
National Sentence Text: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have density and water absorption characteristics conforming to concrete types A, B, C, or D described in CSA A165.1, Concrete Block Masonry Units.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.2.6. Concrete Units Exposed to the Weather
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have weight and water absorption characteristics conforming to Classes A, B, C or D, described in CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units".
Variation Label: Concrete Units Exposed to the Weather

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.3.2.(6), mortar shall be used and placed in final position within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25Â°C or higher, or within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25Â°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , mortar shall be used and placed in final position, within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25ÃÂ°C or higher, and  within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25ÃÂ°C.

National Sentence Text: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the ties shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 9.20.9.4. to 9.20.9.4.(6).
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more wythes are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the ties shall conform to the requirements in Sentences  to .

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 9.20.9.4. and 9.20.9.4.(9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences  and , where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.

National Article Title: Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked VENTILATION FAN. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences ,  and . P/T Sentence Text: The principal exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to , any mechanical air exhausting device, other than the principal ventilation fan operating at a rate not greater than the maximum permitted by Table 9.32.3.3., shall be provided with outdoor makeup air supplied by a fan rated to deliver outdoor air to the dwelling unit at a rate not less than the exhaust capacity of the device, and not greater than that exhaust capacity plus 10%.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a solid fuel-fired combustion appliance is installed, the ventilation system shall include a heat recovery ventilator that is designed to operate so that the flow of exhaust air does not exceed the flow of intake air in any operating mode, and that complies with the requirements of Article 9.32.3.11.

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8. is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences  to  and permitted by Sentence , cladding on exposing building faces and on exterior walls located above exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible, where the limiting distance is greater than 5.0 m, the limiting distance is greater than 2.5 m where the area and width-to-height ratio of the exposing building face conform to Table 9.10.14.5.-B, the building or fire compartment is sprinklered, the cladding conforms to Subsections 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8. or 9.27.9., is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898, Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), or the cladding conforms to Subsection 9.27.12., is installed with or without furring members over a gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.
Variation Label:
Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
Building Face

National Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall be provided with a cleanout plug located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast-iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, or be designed so that part of the trap can be removed for cleaning purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall,  be provided with a cleanout plug of a minimum ¾ in. size located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug,  be designed so that the trap dip can be completely removed for cleaning purposes, or  be provided with a cleanout installed above the floor as close as practical downstream of the trap when the trap is,  installed below the floor, and  not readily accessible for cleaning as required by Clause (a).

National Sentence Text: Tubular metal or plastic traps conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2/CSA B125.2 Plumbing Waste Fittings shall be used only in accessible locations.

National Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, "Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground outside a building for the rehabilitation of existing drainage systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F 714, Polyethylene  Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter and shall be HDPE 3408 and SDR 11 or heavier. (See Note A-2.2.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground in a drainage system for rehabilitation of existing systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F714, "Polyethylene  Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter" and shall be HDPE 3408, SDR 17 or heavier. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to, CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or  CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11, Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.13.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11, "Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications".

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, "Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast".

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except,  in buildings of industrial occupancy, or  for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
