P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A53 / A53M, "Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot Dipped, Zinc-Coated Welded and Seamless".

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall conform to ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard and ASTM A 182/A 182M, Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or AWWA ANSI/AWWA C228, Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges for Water Service Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1,800 mm)
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall, conform to ASME B16.5, "Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard", and  conform to ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or AWWA C228, "Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges For Water Service Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1 800 mm)".

National Sentence Text: Brazing alloys shall conform to AWS ANSI/AWS A5.8M/A5.8, Filler Metals for Brazing and Braze Welding BCuP range.
P/T Sentence Text: Brazing alloys shall conform to ANSI/AWS A5.8M / A5.8, "Filler Metals for Brazing and Brazed Welding", BCuP range.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical couplings for non-pressure applications shall conform to CSA B602 Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical Couplings for DWV and Sewer Pipe shall be certified to CSA B602, "Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe".

National Sentence Text: Each lavatory in a public washroom shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Note A-2.2.10.6.(4).)
Water hammer arresters shall conform to ASSE ANSI/ASSE 1010, Water Hammer Arresters
P/T Sentence Text: Factory built water hammer arresters shall conform to ANSI/ASSE 1010, "Water Hammer Arresters".

National Sentence Text: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil-or-waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil-or-waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than 40 times the size of the soil-or-waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before changing direction, and 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe after changing direction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil or waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil or waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than,  40 times the size of the soil or waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before the change in direction, and  10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe after the change in direction. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: An indirectly connected fixture that can discharge only clear-water waste other than a drinking fountain need not be protected by a trap. (See Sentence 2.4.2.1. for indirect connections.)
P/T Sentence Text: Reserved

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain by the use of a trap seal primer, using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or other equally effective means.
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain or a hub drain by the use of a trap seal primer, by using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or by equally effective means.

National Sentence Text: A backwater valve is permitted to be installed in a building drain provided that it is a "normally open" design conforming to CSA B70 Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings and it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A backwater valve may be installed in a building drain provided that, it is a "normally open" design conforming to,  CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining",  CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings",  CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or  CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", and  it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.

National Article Title: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of the NBC, multiplied by the sum of the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.4. Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", multiplied by the sum of, the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and  one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil-or-waste stack is 1.5 m or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.-B or Table 2.4.10.6.-C, whichever is the less restrictive.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.6. Hydraulic Loads to Soil or Waste Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil or waste stack is 1 500 mm or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8.

National Sentence Text: Systems for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-F383 Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Packaged systems for solar heating of potable water in residential occupancies shall be installed in conformance with CAN/CSA-F383, "Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems".

National Sentence Text: Backflow preventers required by Sentence  shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection. (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The backflow preventer required by Sentence  shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection.

National Sentence Text: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 2.6.3.2.-A and 2.6.3.2.-D when using a detailed engineering design method.
P/T Sentence Text: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 7.6.3.2.A. and 7.6.3.2.D. when using a detailed engineering design method.

National Sentence Text: For fixtures listed in Table 2.6.3.2.-A that are permitted to have a supply pipe 3/8 inch in size, a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture.
P/T Sentence Text: For fixtures listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A that have a permitted supply pipe size of 3/8 in., a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture or device.

A standpipe and hose system shall have an adequate water supply capable of producing a hose stream of at least 6 m from the hose nozzle at the highest fire hose outlet, and be served by at least one fire department connection located on the outside of the building adjacent to a street, readily accessible to the fire department.
A closure in a fire separation between fire compartments referred to in Sentence  shall be weatherstripped or otherwise designed and installed to retard the passage of smoke.

P/T Article Title: 9.40.2.2. Performance Level Evaluation and Compensating Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where the proposed construction would reduce the performance level of an existing building, compensating construction shall be required in conformance with Articles 11.4.3.1., 11.4.3.2., 11.4.3.4. and 11.4.3.6.
Variation Label: Performance Level Evaluation and Compensating Construction

P/T Article Title: 9.5.9.2. Doors to Rooms Containing Water Closets
P/T Sentence Text: A door shall be provided to each room containing a water closet within a dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Doors to Rooms Containing Water Closets

P/T Sentence Text: A hose station in a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy is permitted to be located in a secure area, or in a lockable cabinet provided that, identical keys for all cabinets are located at all guard stations, or electrical remote release devices are provided and are connected to an emergency power supply.
Every opening in an ash storage bin shall be protected by a tight-fitting metal door with metal frame securely fastened to the bin

If a firefighters elevator is not operational  the supervisory staff shall be notified, and  where the firefighters elevator is not operational for more than 24 hours, the fire department and the building occupants shall be notified by means of the procedure established under Sentence .
A door in an access to exit in a gaming premise is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic locking device conforming to Sentences 3.4.6.16. and .
If contaminated, soil surrounding the storage tanks described in Sentence  shall be replaced with clean fill.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: The entraining load for each platform shall be the sum of the entraining loads for each track serving that platform and the entraining load for each track shall be based on the entraining load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.
The water supply available shall be adequate for hose streams and monitor towers, based on the provision of approved fire protection.
Except as permitted in Sentence , sprinkler systems shall comply with Article 3.2.5.5. of the 1986 Building Code.

Storage, handling and use of portable oxygen systems shall be in conformance with CSA-Z305.12, "Safe Storage, Handling, and Use of Portable Oxygen Systems in Residential Buildings and Health Care Facilities".
Air admittance valves shall, only vent fixtures located on the same storey, and  be connected to the horizontal fixture drain.

P/T Article Title: 1.1.1.6. Enhancements to Division B, Part 3 Building Envelope of the 2015 NECB
P/T Sentence Text: Notwithstanding of Sentence 3.3.1.2. of Division B of the 2015 NECB, where Section 3.3. Trade-Off Path of the 2015 NECB is used and where the total skylight area to gross roof area ratio of the proposed building is less than the maximum ratio permitted in Sentence 3.2.1.4. of Division B of the 2015 NECB, the total skylight area to gross roof area ratio of the reference building shall be equal to the proposed building.

This Section applies to homes for special care within the meaning of the Homes for Special Care Act, where the building height does not exceed 3 storeys and the building area does not exceed 600 m2, sleeping accommodation is provided for more than three but not more than 10 residents, and residents do not require nursing care.
Except as permitted in Sentence , sections of sprinkler systems subject to freezing shall be converted to a dry-pipe or antifreeze system with a separate control valve for that part of the system.

The occupant load of a room in which a dance floor is situated shall be based on that portion of the room that is not occupied by the dance floor except where the occupant load is determined using Subclause (b)(i).
Where a fire service main is supplied with water by more than one source, a check valve shall be installed at each connection with a source of water.

A room containing a water closet shall be located where, it does not open directly into any room or area where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is intended to be stored, prepared, processed, distributed, served, sold or offered for sale, and it is not necessary for the public to go through the food preparation areas to gain access to the plumbing fixtures.

The water supply for the sprinklers referred to in Clause  may be taken from the domestic supply where the supply provides sufficient density for the largest fire compartment and where the supply is approved.
Pile heights for stickered lumber piles shall not exceed 6 m.
The effective area of the surface of the filter medium in each filter bed shall be at least 10 m2 and not more than 50 m2.

If Sentence  requires a fire separation having a 2 h fire-resistance rating, a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h is deemed to comply with Sentence  if the building is sprinklered with a sprinkler system that complies with Article 9.2.5.2., or the building has a detection system that is connected to the building fire alarm system.

Where a leakage test incorporating a liquid test medium, including a flammable liquid or combustible liquid, is performed on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking when, with compensation for volume differentials caused by effects of temperature and tank shell distortion, the test indicates a liquid loss.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  applies to the design and construction of a leaching bed with distribution pipes used within the leaching bed.
The walls of a wave action pool shall be vertical from the water surface to within 150 mm of the bottom.
Despite Sentence , space between chip piles and exposing structures, yard equipment or stock shall not be less than 9 m.

Tape used for sealing joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall meet the flame-resistance requirements for fabric in CAN/ULC-S109, Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films .
A converging aisle shall terminate at, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.

P/T Article Title: 9.5.8.1. Combined Living, Dining, Bedroom and Kitchen Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Subsections 9.5.4. to 9.5.7., where living, dining, bedroom and kitchen spaces are combined in a dwelling unit that contains sleeping accommodation for not more than two persons, the area of the combined spaces shall be not less than 13.5 m2.
Variation Label: Combined Living, Dining, Bedroom and Kitchen Spaces

P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to buildings equipped with an interconnected smoke alarm system.

Where a tactile attention indicator is required, it shall conform to Sentence  and Clauses 4.1.1. and 4.1.2. of ISO 23599, "Assistive Products for Blind and Vision-Impaired Persons Ã¢â¬" Tactile Walking Surface Indicators".
Bags protecting sprinkler heads shall be replaced before they have accumulated deposits that impair the timely operation of the sprinkler head.
High voltage components, including atomizing heads, shall be insulated and protected against mechanical damage and accidental contact or grounding.
For the purposes of Sentence , existing means in place on November 21, 2007.
For the purposes of this Section, "1986 Building Code" means Ontario Regulation 419/86, as it read on February 11, 1987; "existing" means in existence on February 11, 1987.

P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.6. Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: The switch required in Sentence  shall be identified by the words CIRCULATION FAN.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating

P/T Sentence Text: Facilities shall be provided to enable the firewatch personnel to  ensure that a fire warning is sounded to notify occupants, and  communicate with the fire department.

Connections to pressurized piping systems shall be made in accordance with good engineering practice such as described in API RP 1107, "Recommended Pipeline Maintenance Welding Practices", API 2200, "Repairing Crude Oil, Liquefied Petroleum Gas and Product Pipelines", or API RP 2201, "Safe Hot Tapping Practices in the Petroleum and Petrochemical Industries".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall be provided between occupancies regulated under this Section and other major occupancies.
Audible signal appliances need not be installed in a rapid transit station.
Flooring need not comply with Section 9.30., but tight-fitting floors shall be provided to support the live and dead loads.
The maximum travel distance on an elevated platform to the ground floor level, including the travel distance along unenclosed stairs, shall not exceed 45 m.
All steel pipe of 4 in. size and smaller shall be schedule 40 or heavier and fittings of less than 2 in. size shall be galvanized screw fittings.

Despite Sentence , every room containing an assembly occupancy shall be provided with at least  three independent well-separated egress doorways, where its occupant load is 600 persons or more, and  four independent well-separated egress doorways where its occupant load is 1000 persons or more.

Where an existing building is subject to extension, material alteration or repair,  the proposed construction shall comply with Section 11.3., and  the performance level of the building shall be evaluated and compensating construction shall be undertaken in accordance with Section 11.4.
This Subsection does not apply if the stored tires or shredded tires in the storage yard are covered by a minimum depth of 150 mm of noncombustible material.

P/T Article Title:
6.2.3.18. Construction and Installation of
Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supply or return duct is not protected by an insulated exterior wall or where the duct is exposed to an unheated space it shall be insulated to prevent condensation.

Section 9.7 does not apply to a building or part of a building that contains a retirement home, if the building or part of the building satisfies the requirements for a retirement home contained in the Building Code as it read at any time on or after January 1, 2014.
The structure shall have a clearly defined Seismic Force Resisting System (SFRS), as defined in Article 4.1.8.2.

P/T Article Title: Inspection, testing and maintenacne of smoke control equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Smoke control equipment shall be maintained in a manner that ensures that it is fully operational.
Variation Label: Inspection, testing and maintenance of smoke control equipment

P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to electrostatic spray-coating processes involving the use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

Except where zoned mechanical exhaust described in Sentence  has been activated, upon automatic detection of smoke within the volume of the interconnected floor space, the mechanical exhaust described in Sentence  shall be automatically activated and supply air shall be provided in sufficient quantity and at appropriate locations to allow a consistent rate of removal of smoke throughout the volume of the interconnected floor space.
Sprinklers shall be protected by sprinkler guards where there is the possibility of mechanical damage.
A floor drain shall be provided in a public laundry room, garbage room, incinerator room, boiler or heating room that is not located within a dwelling unit.
An emergency power supply for the emergency lighting system required in Sentence  shall comply with Sentences 3.2.7.4. and 3.2.7.7. and Article 3.2.7.5.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: If a fire-protection rating of 1 h or less is required, existing closures are deemed to comply with Sentence  if they consist of hollow metal or kalamein doors in hollow metal frames, with openings, if any, protected by wired glass and equipped with self-closing and latching devices, or wired glass screens set in fixed steel frames.
Floor areas containing rooms or areas used by the residents shall be separated into at least two zones by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

A saddle hub or saddle clamp may be installed in a building drain or building sewer of nominal diameter not less than 8 in. and that is in service provided that the connecting branch is at least two pipe sizes smaller than the run of the building drain or building sewer to which it is connected.
In buildings greater than 6 storeys in building height, at least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters.
Despite Sentence , other approved means may be used to ensure adequate fire department access to the piles.

Unless otherwise approved, at least one smoke alarm shall be installed on each floor of a multi-level guest suite and the smoke alarms shall be interconnected so that the actuation of one smoke alarm will cause all smoke alarms within the guest suite to sound.
This Subsection applies to bowling alleys.
If a standpipe system or any part thereof is shut down  the fire department and building occupants shall be notified in accordance with Article 1.1.1.1., and  the supervisory staff shall be notified.

The straps described in Sentence  may be installed against one of the sheathings listed in Table 9.23.16.2.A. provided that,  the tie is in contact with the exterior surface of the sheathing, and  the sheathing beneath the tie is not compressed.
A plumbing fixture that is not located in a Group B occupancy need not comply with Sentence  if the building is sprinklered.

Air exhausted from spray operations shall not be recirculated, except where recirculation is acceptable, as described in NFPA 33, "Standard for Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials".
Sentence  does not apply where the building is sprinklered.
Portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating conforming to the requirements of Section 6.2 may be provided in lieu of the requirements of Sentence .

Emergency lighting required in Sentence  shall be  designed to provide illumination for a duration of at least  2 h in buildings whose highest floor level is more than 18 m above grade, and  30 min in buildings whose highest floor level is not more than 18 m above grade,  supplied by a source of energy separate from the primary electrical supply for the building, and  designed to be automatically actuated when the power to the building is interrupted.
Pumps required to have a rated net head pressure greater than 280 kPa and their controllers shall be listed and labelled.

In this Part,Soil means in-situ, naturally occurring, unconsolidated mineral or organic material, at the earth's surface that is at least 100 mm thick and capable of supporting plant growth, and includes material compacted or cemented by soil forming processes, but does not include displaced materials such as gravel dumps, mine spoils, or like deposits.
Fire separations shall be provided between theatrical stages and assembly occupancies in compliance with Sentences 3.3.2.14. to  of the 1986 Building Code.

P/T Article Title: Furniture in corridors serving guest suites
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence 2.4.1.1.(2), corridors serving as access to exits for guest suites may contain solid wood or other approved furniture, provided the furniture does not create an obstruction to the egress route.
The site to which the leaching bed fill is added shall be generally clear of vegetation.

A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not considered as a basement in Sentence 3.2.2.5. of the 1994 Building Code.
Buildings described in Sentence  that are sprinklered in conformance with Article 9.4.5.2. on January 1, 2014 are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
A Class 3 sewage system shall not be constructed where the daily design sanitary sewage flow to the system exceeds 1 000 L/day.
The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5. between a retirement home and a repair garage shall have no openings.
Dead end corridors shall not be longer than 6 m plus the width of the corridor, unless otherwise approved.
Existing exit stairways separated from the remainder of the building by walls consisting of lath and plaster or gypsum wallboard are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .

If a building contains a storage garage, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed  adjacent to each sleeping area in each suite of residential occupancy that has a common wall or common floor/ceiling assembly with the storage garage, and  adjacent to sleeping rooms that are not within a dwelling unit.
Existing fire separations consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board are deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
Except as provided in Sentences  and , turnstiles, checkout counters, railings or barriers shall not obstruct the exits or access to exits from any room, floor area or storey.

In a building that is 4 or more storeys in building height or has a total area of 4000 m2 or more, an annunciator panel shall be installed near the main entrance, in the main reception area or other approved location that is readily accessible to the fire department, and indicate all floors with not more than one floor per zone indicated.

The following buildings or parts of buildings need not to comply with building envelope requirements:  any building space which uses energy for space conditioning at a rate less than 12 W/m² under peak conditions,  warehouses and storage rooms where the design indoor temperature does not exceed 10°C,  except conditioned spaces of buildings exposed to unheated storage garages and unheated storage rooms, unheated storage garages and unheated storage rooms, and  where part of a single enclosed space is heated.  Where specifically noted in this Supplementary Standard or documents referenced in Sentence 12.2.1.1. of Division B of the Building Code, certain other buildings or elements of buildings shall be exempt.
Fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall be provided between residential occupancies and other major occupancies.

Storm sewage or greywater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for, water closets,  urinals,  sub-surface irrigation, or  the priming of traps.
Except as provided in Sentences  to , the requirements in Subsection 3.2.5. shall not apply.

In a food premises, where dressing rooms are provided for employees, there shall be separate dressing rooms for males and females that, are large enough for the employees to change and store their clothing, and are equipped with lockers or other facilities suitable for storing the clothing of the employees.
Smoke detectors shall be provided in corridors serving guest suites in buildings of combustible construction.
A Type A dispersal bed shall be backfilled with leaching bed fill so as to ensure that, after the leaching bed fill settles, the surface of the leaching bed will not form any depressions.
Water closets and urinals shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B45.0, "General Requirements for Plumbing Fixtures".

If a fire-resistance rating of 1 h or less is required, existing wall assemblies, floor assemblies, ceilings and their supporting assemblies, consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board, are deemed to comply with Sentence .

Underground mains and connections shall be hydrostatically tested for 2 hours at a hydrostatic pressure of 350 kPa  in excess of the maximum hydrostatic pressure in service, but not less than 1400 kPa (gauge).
Except as provided in Sentences  to , portable extinguishers shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts for spray booths and spray rooms shall be securely supported and constructed of sheet steel in accordance with Table 5.12.4.A.
Except as provided in Sentence  and Sentence 8.7.8.2.(2), a Type B dispersal bed shall conform to the requirements of Article 8.7.2.1.

P/T Article Title: Central Alarm and Control Facilities and Voice Communication Systems for Life Safety
P/T Sentence Text: The checking, inspecting and testing of central alarm and control facilities and voice communication systems for life safety shall be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Section 6.3.
Variation Label: CACF and Voice communication systems for life safety

P/T Sentence Text: A ventilation system required in Sentence  shall be provided with monitoring devices indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system malfunctions.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Recirculating air handling systems that serve more than 1 storey or more than one zone as described in Sentence 9.4.2.7. shall be arranged to shut down upon actuation of the fire alarm system.
The roof of a building located in a salvage yard shall not be used for storage purposes.

National Article Title:
Door Swing 
Direction of Door Swing
P/T Sentence Text: A door serving a single dwelling unit shall swing on its vertical axis.

Buildings not described in Articles 9.4.2.2. and 9.4.2.3. shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min for floor assemblies and walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies, and be sprinklered, where the building is of combustible construction.
Space-heating appliances, steam pipes and other hot surfaces shall not be located in an area subject to accumulation of deposits of combustible residue from spray operations.

Notwithstanding Sentence 1.1.1.3. of the 2015 NECB, where the requirements of the Building Code or the requirements of this Division are in conflict with the requirements of the 2015 NECB, the requirements of the Building Code and the requirements of this Division shall govern.

A manual pull station shall be red in colour, readily accessible and unobstructed, readily visible, and unless otherwise approved, installed at a height not less than 1.2 m and not more than 1.5 m, measured vertically from the finished floor surface.
A sign shall be posted indicating the necessity of grounding equipment and objects identified in Sentences  and .

An existing fire alarm system is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence  where the system complies with Articles 9.6.4.2. to 9.6.4.9., and operates in accordance with Article 3.2.4.4. of the 1990 Building Code.

For the purpose of identifying the pipe material where plastic water pipe is used underground for a service pipe, the end of the pipe inside the building shall be brought above ground for a distance not less than 300 mm and not greater than 450 mm. (See Appendix A.)
The heating system capacity shall be based on the heating load calculated in accordance with Sentence 6.2.1.1.(1).

The water in a public pool and its recirculation system shall be separated from the potable water supply and from the sewer or drainage system into which it drains by air gaps or other devices that prevent, the water in the pool or its recirculation system from flowing back into the potable water supply, and the water in the sewer or drainage system from flowing back into the pool or its recirculation system.
Despite Sentences  and , existing sprinkler systems providing adequate protection may be approved.
Exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Access routes for fire fighting shall be provided in accordance with the requirements of Article 3.2.5.2. of the 1986 Building Code.
Except as permitted in Sentence , no bottle trap shall be used in a plumbing system.
Except as provided in this Article, the number of water closets required for employees in mercantile occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.8.

Unless otherwise approved, emergency electric power required for emergency lighting systems required in Sentence 9.9.3.14. shall be installed in conformance with CSA-C282, "Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings" or CSA-C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment", as applicable.
Sentence  does not apply to tight-filled storage tanks that were installed on or before December 31, 2014 and that meet the requirements of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Article Title: 1.1.1.6. Enhancements to Division B, Part 3 Building Envelope of the 2015 NECB
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  shall be added to Article 3.2.2.3. of Division B of the 2015 NECB.  The maximum solar heat gain coefficient of fenestration shall comply with Table 3.2.2.3.A.

Plastic materials used in the construction of sign faces shall, have an average burning rate not greater than 65 mm/min in sheets 1.5 mm thick when tested in accordance with ASTM D635, "Rate of Burning and/or Extent and Time of Burning of Plastics in a Horizontal Position", have an average burning rate not greater than 140 mm/min when tested in accordance with ASTM D568, "Rate of Burning and/or Extent and Time of Burning of Flexible Plastics in a Vertical Position", and have a measurement of material thickness in accordance with Method B-Machinists Micrometer Without Ratchet of ASTM D374, "Thickness of Solid Electrical Insulation".
If the building is 3 storeys or less in building height, a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 30 min is deemed to comply with Sentence .

Walkways and platforms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level not less than 50 lx at floor or tread level and at angles and intersections at changes of level where there are stairs or ramps.

Where a rapid transit station is erected above and below the adjoining finished ground level, the above ground portion of the station shall be of noncombustible construction and shall conform to the requirements in Sentence .

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Where a 20 min fire-protection rating is required, or in a fire separation required under Article 9.6.2.5., existing closures consisting of 45 mm solid core wood doors installed in solid wood or hollow metal frames and equipped with self-closing and latching devices are deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and .

All holding tanks shall be of such design and construction as will allow the complete removal of solid matter that can be expected to settle in the holding tank through an apparatus or device suitable for allowing the contents of the holding tank to be removed from the holding tank.

An earth pit privy shall be constructed in the following manner: the bottom of the pit shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table,  the sides of the pit shall be reinforced so as to prevent their collapse,  the pit shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by not less than 600 mm of soil or leaching bed fill, and  the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure of the earth pit privy shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.
Despite Sentence , an existing laboratory that has fire separations consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Existing wired glass closures set in fixed steel frames in a fire separation are deemed to be in compliance with Article 9.3.3.8.

Where a rapid transit station includes more than one standpipe riser there shall be a cross-connection pipe having a diameter not less than 100 mm between each standpipe riser so that supplying of water through any fire department connection will furnish water throughout each riser.
A public corridor may be used as part of an engineered smoke control system.

P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: Branch supply ducts leading from the main distribution trunk duct required by Sentence  to the rooms to which outdoor air is to be distributed shall be provided and shall be sized according to Part 6, except that the branch supply ducts may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.7.B. where,  the total duct length from the outdoor hood to any supply register does not exceed 21 m, and  the total number of fittings does not exceed 8.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.7.(1), glass in guards shall conform to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-13, Glass in Guards .

P/T Article Title: 3.2.2.48E. Group C, Retirement Home, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered,
P/T Sentence Text: A retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence  provided,  except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered,  it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and  it has a building area not more than,  4 800 m2 if 1 storey in building height,  2 400 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, or  1 600 m2 if 3 storeys in building height.
A public corridor shall comply with Sentences 6.2.3.9. and .
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: The land in the vicinity of a sewage system shall be maintained in a condition that will not cause damage to, or impair the functioning of, the sewage system.
In each rapid transit station located at the end of a line, a washroom for each sex, containing no fewer than three water closets and two lavatories, shall be provided for use by the public.
The maximum piling height allowed in Sentence  shall be posted in conspicuous locations.

The occupant load of a floor area may vary if it is used for different occupancies at different times, but the exits from the floor area shall provide the aggregate exit width prescribed in Article 9.9.3.2. for the greatest occupant load.

P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: The outside air supply duct required by Sentence  shall not be considered to provide combustion and/or dilution air to fuel-burning appliances.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

P/T Sentence Text: Bends in copper tubing of soft or bending temper shall be made with tools manufactured and sized for the purpose.
Ovens shall not be located in any storey below grade.

Except as provided by Sentence , where required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, a room intended for the indoor storage of cylinders containing flammable compressed gases shall meet the following requirements,  it is separated from the remainder of the building by a gas-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h,  it is located on an exterior wall of the building,  it can be entered from the exterior,  it is ventilated in conformance with Sentence ,  it is constructed so that an exterior wall provides explosion venting,  in the ratio of 0.2 m2 for each cubic metre of room volume, or  in the ratio computed in accordance with NFPA 68, "Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting", but in no case less than 0.065 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of room volume,  it is not intended to contain fuel-fired equipment or high temperature heating elements, and  it is not intended to be used for a purpose other than the storage of compressed gas.
Existing wired glass screens set in fixed steel frames are acceptable in fire separations required by this Article.
Signs prohibiting smoking that meet the requirements of Article 2.4.3.2. shall be conspicuously posted in any place where pin refinishing occurs.

Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence  and that is installed in a building of industrial occupancy shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

Maintenance of any equipment involved in the storage, handling, processing and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, whose failure would significantly increase the fire or explosion hazard and whose maintenance requirements are not addressed in another Part of this Code shall be maintained in accordance with its listed requirements and if not listed, be maintained in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations or good engineering practice.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: The total length of distribution pipe shall, not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or  not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in a fire separation that is required to have a 30 min fire-resistance rating shall be protected with closures that have a fire-protection rating not less than 20 min.

Sentence  does not apply to,  combustible sprinkler piping and associated adhesives,  combustible tubing for pneumatic controls and associated adhesives, provided the tubing has an outside diameter not more than 10 mm,  combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives used in public pools and public spas, and  combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives concealed in a concrete floor slab.

Except as provided in Sentence , the sampling required by Sentence  shall be conducted, initially, once during the first 12 months after the sewage system was put into use, and  thereafter, once during every 12 month period, at least 10 months and not more than 18 months after the previous sampling has been completed.
Return-air inlets shall not be installed in an enclosed room or crawl space that provides combustion air to a fuel-fired appliance.
Alternative methods to prevent freezing of sprinkler piping may be used where approved.
Every rapid transit station shall be provided with an emergency ventilation system conforming to NFPA 130, "Fixed Guideway Transit and Passenger Rail Systems".
Measures to control spilled flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Where a barrier-free path of travel conforming to 3.8. is provided into a suite of residential occupancy and where a bathroom within the suite is at the level of the suite entrance door, the doorway to such bathroom and to each bedroom at the same level as such bathroom shall have, when the door is in the open position, a clear width of not less than,  760 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space not less than 1 060 mm wide, and  810 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space less than 1 060 mm wide.

Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence , in an elementary or secondary school, a hazardous classroom containing an auto repair shop shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire-separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than, 2 h where the building is not sprinklered, or 1 h where the building is sprinklered.
Service rooms and storage facilities, including rooms and facilities that contain electrical or mechanical equipment or chemicals or chemical feeders, shall be equipped with a secure locking device.
Fire separations required by this Section to have a fire-resistance rating shall comply with Subsection 9.10.3. of the 1986 Building Code.
Dry-pipe valves shall be trip tested annually.
Where an appliance is separated in conformance with this Article, sufficient combustion air shall be brought directly from the outside for the safe operation of the appliance.
Hydrants shall be readily available and unobstructed for use at all times.
The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.1.2. of Division A.
A sign shall not be located in proximity to existing above ground electrical conductors, unless the sign meets the clearance requirements of Subsection 3.1.19.
Provision shall be made for two or more lifeguard control stations on each side of the pool deck adjacent to which the still water depth exceeds 1 000 mm.
Filters shall not be alternately used for different types of coating materials if the combination of materials might result in spontaneous heating or ignition.

A Class 5 sewage system may be installed in the following circumstances: where the proposed use of the sewage system is for a temporary operation, excluding seasonal recreational use, not exceeding 12 months in duration,  to remedy an unsafe sewage system where the remediation of the unsafe condition by the installation of a Class 4 sewage system is impracticable,  to upgrade a sewage system serving an existing building, where upgrading through the use of a Class 4 sewage system is not possible due to lot size, site slope or clearance limitations, or  as an interim measure for a lot or parcel of land until municipal sewers are available, provided that the municipality undertakes to ensure the continued operation of an approved hauled sewage system until the municipal sewers are available.
A Type B dispersal bed shall not be located closer than the minimum horizontal distances set out in Table 8.2.1.6.B. and these distances shall be increased when required by Sentence 8.7.4.2.(11).
Deck-mounted, hand-held, flexible-hose spray attachments are exempt from the thermal shock requirements of Sentences  and .
Wheeled carts shall be stored after use so as not to obstruct access to exits in retail outlets where wheeled carts are used by customers.
With the exception of charging electrodes and their connections, transformers, power packs, control apparatus and all other electrical components shall be located outside the powder-coating area.
Where there is a change of direction greater than 45° in a sanitary building drain or a sanitary building sewer, a cleanout shall be installed at each change in direction.

P/T Article Title: Requirements for locking, latching and fastening devices
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply in rapid transit stations that comply with the Building Code.

Where the building control valve required by Sentence  is of 1 in. trade size or smaller, the drain port may be an integral part of the building control valve in the form of a stop and waste valve and the drain port shall be located on the water distribution system side of the stop and waste valve.
A standpipe and hose system shall be installed in conformance with the Building Code and equipped with spray nozzles so that all parts of an oven structure can be reached by a hose stream.

Unless it can be shown to be unnecessary, where the percolation time is 10 minutes or greater, the location of all components within a sewage system shall be in conformance with the clearances listed in Article 8.2.1.5. or 8.2.1.6.
Despite Clause 2(a), where storage consists of more than one class of liquid, placards that indicate the danger symbol or individual placards for each class of liquid shall be acceptable.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence , window openings, except first storey display windows, shall be protected by wired glass in fixed steel frames if located within 3 storeys below, within 10 m below, within 1.8 m above or within 3 m horizontally of an exterior exit stairway, fire escape or exterior exit passageway.
The surface temperature of electrostatic fluidized bed coating areas shall not exceed 66°C.
Fuel-fired appliances, except for cooking appliances, shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
If a room contains not more than 1 water closet, the doorway to the room shall be provided with a full height door that is capable of being locked from the inside.
The platform occupant load for each platform in a rapid transit station shall be the greater of the a.m. or p.m. peak period loads calculated in accordance with Sentences  to .
Access openings shall be located to facilitate the pumping of all compartments and the servicing of the inlet and outlet of each compartment not accessible by removal of the tank top or part of it.
Each portable extinguisher shall have a tag securely attached to it showing the maintenance or recharge date, the servicing agency and the signature of the person who performed the service.

Exit doors from rental spaces are not required to swing on a vertical axis provided,  the area of the rental space is not more than 50 m2, and  the travel distance within the rental space is not more than 10 m.

A normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel shall comply with the following requirements:  all doorways in public corridors in the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Sentence ,  door opening devices that are the only means of operation on doors in the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Sentence ,  where a vision panel is provided in a door in the normally occupied floor area, the panel shall comply with Sentence ,  doors consisting of a sheet of glass in the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Sentence , and  where a power door operator is installed for doors in the normally occupied floor area, the control for the power door operator shall comply with Sentence .

P/T Article Title: 3.4.6.1. Surface Finish of Ramps and Stairs
P/T Sentence Text: A tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. shall be installed,  at the top of the stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the top stair, and (b)	at the leading edge of landings where a doorway opens onto stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the landing

P/T Article Title: 3.3.6.4. Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to a room intended for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol
The trap seal depth on fixtures draining to an acid waste system shall be a minimum of 50 mm.
Revoked: O. Reg. 256/14, s. 393 .

P/T Article Title: Extinguishers for flammable and combustible liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The distance travelled to reach a portable extinguisher required by Sentence  shall not exceed 15 m.
Where a fire escape of the type referred to in Article 9.3.3.4. is used as an exit, it is deemed to comply with the requirements of Articles 9.9.2.2. and 9.9.2.3. of the 1986 Building Code.
Closures referred to in Sentences  and  shall be equipped with latches and self-closing devices.

If a fire alarm system is required in a building, electrical supervision shall be provided to indicate, on the fire alarm system annunciator, a loss of power to a heat tracing cable that is installed to heat, a standpipe riser, a sprinkler line as part of a fire suppression system, or an exit or means of egress to keep it free of ice and snow.

Where elevator doors opening into an interconnected floor space are protected by vestibules in conformance with Sentence , the elevator doors opening into the lowest storey of the interconnected floor space need not be protected by such vestibules.
Peat and humus are not acceptable materials for compacted earth cover in Sentence .
This Section applies to the construction of a Class 4 sewage system.
When a carbon monoxide alarm is replaced in a suite of residential occupancy constructed before August 6, 2001, the replacement carbon monoxide alarm shall meet the requirements of Article 2.16.2.1.

At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Articles 3.2.6.8. and 3.2.6.9. of the 1994 Building Code in buildings where the vertical distance between the floor of the top storey and grade exceeds 18 m.

Except as provided in Sentence , the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months shall, be designed to exceed by not less than 15% the energy efficiency levels required by Sentence 12.2.1.1.(3), or  conform to Chapters 1 and 3 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-12, "Energy Efficiency for Housing".

In a long-term care home, a Group B, Division 3 occupancy and a retirement home, a continuous handrail shall be provided on both sides of a stair throughout the length of the stair, including landings, except where a handrail is interrupted by doorways or newels at changes in direction.
If cartridge-type filters are used for a public spa, the filters shall be a surface-type that is designed for a maximum flow rate of 0.27 L/s/m2 effective filter area.
Standpipe hose shall be unracked, unreeled or unrolled and inspected at least annually and after use, and any worn hose or gaskets in the couplings at the hose valves and at the nozzle replaced.
A standpipe system shall be installed in every basement of a building that is regulated by Sentence 3.2.2.15.(2).
The centre line of the seat for the pool lift shall be located over the deck and a minimum of 400 mm from the edge of the pool when in the raised position.
Standpipe and hose systems shall be installed in accordance with the Building Code.

Despite Sentences  and , where the Chief Fire Official is satisfied that the performance and reliability of an existing fire alarm system will provide an adequate early warning level, the existing system may remain, be modified or be extended, provided compatibility of components is maintained.
A telephone accessible for emergency use shall be installed for every Class B pool within 30 m of the pool.
Drain boards shall be arranged to drain back to the dip tank.
Cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall be stored and handled in conformance with NFPA 40, "Standard for the Storage and Handling of Cellulose Nitrate Motion Picture Film".

National Article Title: 5.3.1.3. Location and Installation of Materials Providing Thermal
P/T Article Title: 5.3.1.3. Location and Installation of Materials Providing Thermal
Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentence , garbage intake room doors that swing inward shall be acceptable without a latching device.

Sets of steps or ladders recessed into pool side walls and having continuous vertical grab bars on each side of them shall be located at intervals of not more than 7.5 m along portions of the pool where the still water depth exceeds 1 000 mm, except that no steps or ladders shall be located within 3 m of the corners at the deep end of the pool.

Where portable extinguishers have been tested and are rated as being acceptable for fighting more than one class of fire, each class of fire for which they are acceptable shall be designated on each extinguisher.

If a special fire suppression system or any part thereof is shut down  the fire department and building occupants shall be notified in accordance with Article 1.1.1.1., and  the supervisory staff shall be notified.

P/T Article Title: 3.1.5.22. Combustible Components in Public Pools and Public
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible fittings and components in a public pool or public spa, including main drains, piping, skimmers, return inlets, steps, ladder rungs and liners, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
Where storage areas are fenced or otherwise enclosed, gateways having a clear width of at least 3.5 m shall be provided to permit entry of fire department vehicles.

If a spray operation is a major occupancy in a building, the spray operation shall be separated from the remainder of the building in accordance with Article 3.1.3.1. of Division B of the Building Code.
A written spill procedure shall be provided for laboratories in conformance with Article 4.1.6.4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Sentence  does not apply to hot water supplied to installed dishwashers or clothes washers.
Each exit stairway shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1h.

P/T Article Title: Buildings over 4 storeys but not more than 6 storeys
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings to which Articles 9.9.2.2. and 9.9.2.3. do not apply and that are not more than 6 storeys in building height shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min for floor assemblies and walls, columns and arches supporting floor assemblies, and be sprinklered, where the building is of combustible construction.
Portable extinguishers for Class A fires shall be provided on vehicles operating on chip piles in addition to the units for Class B fires normally required for the vehicles.
No stairway enclosure or corridor shall be used as a plenum to exhaust air from other areas.
Supervisory staff shall be available on notification of a fire emergency to fulfil their obligation as described in the fire safety plan.
Where cathodic protection equipment is installed to prevent corrosion of steel tanks, the equipment shall be inspected annually.
Key-operated switches for emergency recall described in Sentence  shall be provided and shall be located on the outside of each elevator shaft at the level of the fare-paid area control.

There shall be a hard-surfaced pool deck at least 3 m wide immediately adjacent to the pool wall at the shallow end of the pool and at least 1 500 mm wide immediately adjacent to all walls of the pool.
Gas tanks on vehicles to be salvaged shall be drained and ventilated prior to salvage operations.
A public address system compatible with the fire safety plan required under Subsection 2.8.2. is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence .
A restaurant is permitted to be classified as a Group E major occupancy provided the restaurant is designed to accommodate not more than 30 persons consuming food or drink.

P/T Article Title: Protection of openings in fire separations
P/T Sentence Text: Existing closures in fire separations to which Article 9.5.2.7. applies are deemed to be in compliance with Sentences  and  where the floor area is sprinklered, or interconnected smoke alarms are installed in accordance with Article 9.5.4.4., the building has not more than four dwelling units and the building provides sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons.

Subject to Article 9.8.2.3., each residential unit shall be separated from other rooms and areas by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 15 min and be equipped with interconnected smoke alarms that comply with Article 9.8.4.1.

When a leakage test is required by Sentence  on an aboveground storage tank, it is permitted to determine the source of leakage whenever a leak is suspected, and before backfilling in the case of an underground tank, or before filling or putting into service in the case of an aboveground tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Despite Sentences  and , existing rooms opening directly into an exit stairway may be approved.

Except as provided in Sentence , where the exterior cladding of a wall is required to be noncombustible, a plastic sign face or a group of contiguous plastic sign faces may be placed over such cladding provided each such sign face or group of contiguous sign faces, does not exceed 30% of the wall area of the storey on which it is installed, does not exceed 15 m2 in area or 1 200 mm in height at each storey, and when located above the first storey, is vertically separated from other plastic sign faces by 1 200 mm of noncombustible construction unless separated by a horizontal noncombustible projection such as a canopy, extending the full width of, and projecting at least 900 mm beyond the exterior sign face.
Enclosed processing buildings handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be ventilated as specified in Subsection 4.1.7.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

P/T Sentence Text: Refuse storage rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and sprinklered to provide a minimum average density of 6.5 L/m2 over the room area.
Spraying areas shall be located in rooms protected by listed and labelled automatic fixed extinguishing equipment.

Where a vision panel is provided in a door in a barrier-free path of travel, such panel shall be at least 75 mm in width and be located so that, the bottom of the panel is not more than 900 mm above the finished floor, and the edge of the panel closest to the latch is not more than 250 mm from the latch side of the door.

This Section applies to the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months.
Subject to Article 2.1.1.3., this Part applies to buildings, premises, tents, air-supported structures and outdoor public amusement areas.
A separate exhaust duct shall be provided for each spray booth, except that a common duct may be used if it serves spray booths having a combined open frontal area of not more than 1.8 m2.
Sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste may be provided in lieu of toilet fixtures.
Where a building drain connects to a stack through a wall or floor, the drain shall retain its full size through the wall or floor.
The heating system used in drying operations shall be interlocked so that it cannot be started until the associated ventilation system is in operation.
No pipe adaption shall be made by the use of a bushing that leaves a square edge or shoulder on the inside of the pipe or fitting.
